0.title: Pics of liquor bottles surface after CM Shinde’s Dussehra rally in Mumbai
0.article_body: Yuva Sena, the youth wing of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, shared pictures of liquor bottles and garbage, a day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally. The pictures are of Mumbai University's Kalina campus, which provided the parking facility for the event. Yuva Sena workers shared images of liquor bottles, thrown-away food and have demanded action against the organisers.

1.title: Local trains hit due to snag at Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station
1.article_body: Suburban train services were disrupted on Thursday due to a technical snag in overhead wires at south Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station. The snag, which occurred at about 1:00 pm, resulted in trains heading towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus being held up. Affected services have been diverted to the fast line and restoration work is in full swing, Central Railway said.

2.title: Electronics Mart India's IPO subscribed 6 times on day 2
2.article_body: Electronics Mart India's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed six times on Thursday, the second day of bidding, as the participants bought 37.42 crore equity shares against the offer size of 6.25 crore shares. Retail investors subscribed 6.98 times, while non-institutional investors bought 8.08 times the portion. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 2.67 times the reserved portion.

3.title: Shameful: NCW chief on Cong leader's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
3.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma has criticised Congress leader Udit Raj after he said, "No country should get President like Droupadi Murmu. Chamchagiri also has its limits." "[Raj's] statement is not just against a woman but a constitutional head of government," the NCW chief said. "Comments made are condemnable. The derogatory language used is shameful," she added.

4.title: Solomon Islands won't be used by foreign military: Sogavare to Aus PM
4.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese in Canberra. "Solomon Islands will not do anything that will undermine our national security...will never be used for foreign military installations," Sogavare reportedly said. A joint statement issued by Albanese's office said the two leaders discussed bilateral ties, climate change and aspirations for Pacific.

5.title: SpiceJet shares jump 9% after report of ₹1,000 crore government loan
5.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet jumped by 9% on Thursday following reports of the airline likely receiving an additional loan of ₹1,000 crore under the government's modified Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme. According to reports, the funds will help the airline clear its dues and induct new Boeing 737 Max planes. SpiceJet is currently operating less than 50% of its approved flights.

6.title: 19-year-old traces bike, catches thieves in 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai
6.article_body: A 19-year-old boy, along with his cousin, traced his stolen bike and caught the thieves within 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai. After the boy found his bike missing, he rushed to nearby petrol pump, assuming the thieves must have gone there as the bike didn't have enough petrol. When they reached there, they saw the thieves leaving and caught them.

7.title: I would love to see Umran Malik unleashed in Australia: Brett Lee
7.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik and Australia's 23-year-old all-rounder Cameron Green should've been part of their respective teams for the upcoming 2022 T20 WC. "I'd love to see Umran unleashed in Australia...[and] I can't fathom how Cameron isn't in [Australia's] team," he stated. Umran picked 22 wickets in his 14 games in IPL 2022.

8.title: Akasa Air to allow pets on board, bookings to begin from Oct 15
8.article_body: Newly launched airline Akasa Air said passengers can carry pets on board from November, the bookings for which will begin from October 15. One pet per person with weight of up to 7 kgs will be allowed, and domesticated cats and dogs have to be in a cage to board the flight. The pricing for this has not been disclosed.

9.title: Struggled between life, death for 3hrs: U'khand avalanche survivor
9.article_body: Deep Thakur, an Uttarakhand avalanche survivor recounted the experience after being rescued from Draupadi's Danda Peak in Uttarkashi. Thakur said the avalanche came suddenly, following which he and his companions fell into the crevasses about 60 feet deep and struggled between death and life for about three hours. Deep was among the 41 mountaineers who were stuck in the avalanche.

10.title: Gold prices in India surge to highest level in nearly 2 months
10.article_body: Gold rates on Thursday were the highest since August 16 as the Indian benchmark indices rose amid subdued dollar and Treasury yields. On the Multi Commodity Exchange, gold prices were up by 0.51%, touching ₹51,910 per 10 grams around 10:20 am. Gold prices also rose globally. Spot gold was up 0.4% at $1,722.09 per ounce in the initial trade.

11.title: Seen very few marriages work, would like to disprove that: Ali Fazal
11.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said he's seen "very few marriages work" in his life, which is something he'd like to "disprove" in his relationship with Richa Chadha. The actor, who recently got married to Richa, said he shares "something spiritual" with the actress. "I thank her for that because she's made me more spiritually aware than I was before," he said.

12.title: Pune Zilla Parishad sets up 'inspection unit' to monitor public works
12.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has set up a Development and Scheme Inspection Unit to monitor the implementation of public works and welfare schemes. "The unit will have six staffers...With the help of Pune ZP's software system that allows contractors to fill up daily updates on work progress, it will monitor the progress of all public works," an official said.

13.title: 12,000 Meta employees may lose jobs amid 'quiet layoffs': Report
13.article_body: Meta, formerly Facebook, is undergoing "quiet layoffs" that could affect 15% or around 12,000 employees of the company's workforce, Insider reported citing several employees. Meta's executives reportedly told directors across the company to select at least 15% of their team to be labelled as "needs support". These employees will be put on a performance improvement plan and eventually let go.

14.title: Mumbai man sentenced to 10-year jail for raping minor daughter for 7 years
14.article_body: A man in Mumbai was sentenced to ten years in jail for raping his minor daughter for seven years. The accused worked on a ship in Saudi Arabia and visited his family every two months. In 2014, his wife noticed that their daughter avoided him and the girl told her that she was sexually assaulted by her father many times.

15.title: Mumbai's Charni Road's old foot-over bridge to be shut for 45 days
15.article_body: The old foot-over bridge (FOB) of Charni Road station of Mumbai Suburban Railway will be closed for 45 days till November 18 owing to construction work, according to Western Railway. The FOB will be closed for constructing a link connecting the newly constructed foot over-bridge and platforms 2 and 3. Both spans of the existing FOB will be dismantled.

16.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against South Africa
16.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the first ODI against South Africa. The match has been reduced to 40 overs per side contest due to rain delay. Batter Ruturaj Gaikwad and leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi are making their ODI debut for India. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep Yadav.

17.title: Mumbai reports more than 100 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
17.article_body: According to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Mumbai reported 127 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the overall tally to 11,50,828. This comes a day after the city recorded 155 COVID-19 cases. No fresh death due to the infection was recorded on Wednesday, while 116 patients recovered in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in Mumbai is 795.

18.title: Twitter to now let users post tweets with different media formats
18.article_body: Twitter is rolling out a new feature that lets users combine three media formats (GIFs, photos, videos) in a single tweet on both Android and iOS devices. "This feature will roll out globally...with a chance to see mixed media Tweets on the web," Twitter said. Users can also rearrange their media's layout while composing a tweet, it added.

19.title: Roblox enabled a girl's sexual and financial exploitation: Lawsuit
19.article_body: A lawsuit has accused Roblox of enabling a girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men in US' California. The lawsuit claims that the victim came in contact with adult men through Roblox, who encouraged her to use Discord, Snapchat and Instagram. They then exploited her by encouraging her to abuse prescription drugs and send sexually explicit photos of herself.

20.title: 16-kg heroin worth ₹80 crore seized at Mumbai airport, flyer arrested
20.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an airline passenger with drugs at Mumbai airport following a tip-off on Wednesday. The DRI seized 16 kg of heroin valued at more than ₹80 crore from his luggage. The accused, who is a resident of Kerala, revealed that a foreign national had given him $1,000 as commission to take him to India.

21.title: Shocking incident: Thai PM as 34 people killed in shooting at daycare
21.article_body: Thailand PM Prayut Chan-o-cha called the mass shooting at a daycare centre on Thursday that killed at least 34 people, including 22 children, a "shocking incident". The PM has ordered all agencies to urgently treat the wounded. The gunman was a former police officer and he reportedly took his own life following the shooting in Nong Bua Lamphu province.

22.title: WhatsApp's Beta update blocks screenshots of 'View Once' messages
22.article_body: In its latest Android Beta update, WhatsApp has introduced a feature that enables blocking screenshots and screen recordings of 'View Once' messages. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "'View once' is already...popular way to share photos...that don't need to have a permanent digital record. Now WhatsApp is enabling screenshot blocking for 'View Once' messages for an added layer of protection."

23.title: Cong stoops to new low: BJP leader over Udit Raj's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
23.article_body: BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu. "Ajoy Kumar called President Droupadi Murmu as evil and then Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury used the term 'Rashtrapatni', now Congress stoops to a new low!" Poonawalla tweeted. "Udit Raj uses unacceptable language for the first woman Adivasi President," he added.

24.title: 2 arrested for stealing phones worth ₹70 lakh from Hyd Bajaj store
24.article_body: The Rachakonda Police has arrested two persons who allegedly stole as many as 432 cellphones worth ₹70 lakh from a Bajaj Electronics store in Hyderabad in September. Police found three persons wearing face masks entering the store in CCTV footage. The main accused was arrested from Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, while another from West Bengal.

25.title: Batters are to be blamed: Pak Women captain Maroof after defeat vs Thailand
25.article_body: After suffering their first-ever defeat against Thailand in women's T20I history, Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof said their batters are to be blamed for the loss in their Asia Cup match. "Our batters [didn't show] intent...130+ could've been a good total and as a captain, I'm disappointed," added Maroof. Thailand restricted Pakistan to 116/5 and won the match by four wickets.

26.title: 'Ekk Deewana Tha' was mistake, shouldn't have done it: Director
26.article_body: Filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon, who directed 'Ekk Deewana Tha', said the 2012 film was a mistake. The film was a remake of the Tamil film 'Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa'. Gautham stated the original film was "naturally organic film". Speaking about making a remake of it, he said, "I shouldn't have done that...Somebody asked me 'Did you direct 'Ekk Deewana Tha'?'...I said no."

27.title: UAPA invoked against 15 PFI activists arrested during NIA raids in B'luru
27.article_body: Bengaluru City Police invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against 15 Popular Front of India (PFI) activists. The accused were arrested on September 22 following raids by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). "UAPA has been invoked in the case against the accused on account of the involvement of a few in crimes in the past," police said.

28.title: 4 men hit 3 policemen with car, beat them with rods in Gurugram hospital
28.article_body: Three police personnel were injured after a group of four men attacked them in a private hospital in Gurugram, officials said on Wednesday. The accused tried to hit them with their car and later beat them with sticks and iron rods, police said. Police reached the hospital after a brawl broke out when the accused refused to pay for medicines.

29.title: 11-yr-old gets trapped inside lift in Gr Noida, rescued after 45 mins
29.article_body: An 11-year-old boy got trapped inside a lift in Greater Noida's Paramount Emotions society for almost 45 minutes before he was rescued by his parents. CCTV footage of the kid playing inside the lift went viral on social media, in which the boy can be seen pushing the lift buttons and inserting a bottle in between the lift doors.

30.title: I'm sitting with my grandfather & talking about periods, it's progress: Navya
30.article_body: Navya Naveli Nanda said it's a sign of progress as she discussed menstruation on a public forum in the presence of her grandfather Amitabh Bachchan. "It's a sign of life...That's not something...we should be ashamed of, or shy away from," she stated. "Menstruation has been a taboo for a long time, but there has been progress," said Navya.

31.title: Wife expressing desire to work after marriage isn't cruelty: Bombay HC
31.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ruled that if a wife expresses a desire to go to work after marriage, it would not amount to cruelty. The HC said this while dismissing a man's plea for divorce on grounds of cruelty. "The marital life should be accessed as a whole and few isolated instances....will not amount to cruelty," the court added.

32.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
32.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till October 10. Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya may witness it across the next four days. It is very likely over Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Maharashtra on October 8 and 9. Gujarat may witness it from October 8 to 10.

33.title: US believes Ukrainians behind killing of Russian nationalist's daughter: Report
33.article_body: United States intelligence agencies believe that parts of Ukrainian government were behind a car bomb attack that killed Darya Dugina, daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Alexander Dugin, the New York Times reported. It mentioned that US took no part in the attack and was not aware of it. Russia had accused Ukraine's secret service of orchestrating the attack.

34.title: Gujarat govt launches scheme to attract ₹12.5 trillion investments
34.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel unveiled a scheme for attracting investment of ₹12.50 trillion and creating at least 15 lakh jobs in the next five years under Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Schemes for Assistance to Industries. Patel said that the scheme is aimed at encouraging youth to innovate and become job creators as well as de-risking their investments through incentives.

35.title: Rahul kneels down to tie Sonia Gandhi's shoelaces during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic viral
35.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined the Karnataka leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a photo on Twitter showing Rahul Gandhi kneeling next to his mother Sonia Gandhi to tie her shoelaces during the yatra in Karnataka. Tharoor wrote, "Even if she breathes, it also has prayers, Mothers do not break, mothers are mothers!"

36.title: Thailand defeat Pak in a women's T20I for 1st time ever, celebration video goes viral
36.article_body: Thailand defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the league stage of Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 on Thursday. With this, they registered their first-ever victory against Pakistan in women's T20I cricket history. Thailand restricted Pakistan for 116/5 and chased down the target in 19.5 overs. A video of their celebration has gone viral on social media.

37.title: Bihar man detained after threat to 'blow up' Antilia, kill Ambanis
37.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a man from Bihar in connection with threat calls to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's family. On Wednesday, two calls were received at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai, threatening to blow up the hospital and Ambani's residence Antilia. The caller also threatened to kill Mukesh Ambani, Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani & Anant Ambani.

38.title: World's currency reserves shrink by a record $1 trillion this year
38.article_body: The global foreign-currency reserves have declined by about $1 trillion, or 7.8%, this year to $12 trillion, the biggest drop since Bloomberg began keeping a record in 2003. The decline comes amid the central banks of India and the Czech Republic's intervention to support their own currencies. India's reserves have slumped by $96 billion this year to $538 billion.

39.title: Persistent Systems gains after JPMorgan upgrades stock to 'overweight'
39.article_body: After brokerage house JPMorgan upgraded the call on shares of Persistent Systems Limited to 'overweight' from 'neutral', its stock gained on Thursday. JPMorgan gave a revised target price of ₹4,100 apiece. The Pune-headquartered company is JPMorgan's only 'overweight' within the Engineering, Research and Development space. At 1:52 pm, its shares were trading 6.81% higher at ₹3,522 on the BSE.

40.title: Man's Apple Watch overheats, makes crackling sounds and then explodes
40.article_body: An Apple Watch Series 7 overheated, made "crackling sounds" and then "exploded" just as he was throwing it out the window, its owner claimed in a statement in 9to5Mac. The device's owner visited the emergency room because of lead poisoning concerns. Apple arranged a pickup for the affected device, saying it would take the device to its lab for investigation.

41.title: Pic of gunman who killed 34 people including 22 kids at Thailand daycare released
41.article_body: Thailand's Central Investigation Bureau has released a picture of the gunman, an ex-police officer, who killed 34 people including 22 kids at a daycare centre. Media reported that the gunman later shot and killed himself. Mass shootings are rare in Thailand even though the rate of gun ownership is high compared with some other countries in the region.

42.title: Poland says it's in talks to host US nuclear weapons amid Russia threat
42.article_body: Poland has spoken to the US about having NATO's nuclear weapons on its territory, Polish President Andrzej Duda said amid growing fears that Russian President Vladimir Putin could resort to using nuclear arms in Ukraine. However, deploying US nuclear weapons to Poland, a neighbour of Ukraine, could be a violation of NATO's Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and the NATO-Russia Founding Act.

43.title: Prithvi Shaw's name should've been there for SA ODIs: Aakash Chopra
43.article_body: Reacting to Prithvi Shaw's omission from the three-match ODI series against South Africa, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said the 22-year-old's name should have been there in the squad. "I frankly see Shaw playing in the next T20 World Cup...Management should start inducting him and utilising him. His numbers are fantastic in domestic cricket," stated Aakash.

44.title: Virgin Atlantic halts London to Hong Kong flights after nearly 30 years
44.article_body: British airline Virgin Atlantic has decided to suspend Heathrow to Hong Kong service, shut its Hong Kong office after nearly 30 years of operation due to prolonged closure of Russian airspace. "Significant operational complexities due to the ongoing Russian airspace closure have contributed to the commercial decision not to resume flights in March 2023," airline founder Richard Branson said.

45.title: Won't allow screening of 'Adipurush': BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam
45.article_body: BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam has said that the screening of 'Adipurush' won't be allowed as it has "distorted the Hindu gods and goddesses". "Some film producers to earn publicity and money have this habit of distorting facts, but the Hindu society will not tolerate such things," he said. Previously, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra also raised objections against 'Adipurush'.

46.title: Australia proposes changes in privacy policy after Optus data breach
46.article_body: Australian government has proposed changes in consumer privacy rules after a data breach at the country's second-largest mobile operator, Optus, compromised personal details of almost 10 million customers. The amendment will let telcos share government-issued identification data with banks for enhanced monitoring for affected users. Banks will have to destroy data when it is no longer required.

47.title: India's services sector growth hit 6-month low in September: PMI
47.article_body: India's services sector activity fell to a six-month low in September at 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. "September also saw a broad stabilisation of input cost inflation...slowest upturn in prices charged for the provision of services since March," Economics Associate Director Pollyanna De Lima noted. In August, PMI stood at 57.2.

48.title: Reflects their anti-tribal mindset: Sambit Patra on Cong leader's remark on Prez
48.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark for President Droupadi Murmu. "Words used for President Murmu by Congress leader…[are] worrisome, unfortunate," Patra said. "This isn't the first time they have used such words. Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury did it too. This reflects their anti-tribal mindset," he added.

49.title: 11-yr-old girl watching garba dies in MP, CT scan shows bullet in head
49.article_body: An 11-year-old girl collapsed and started bleeding profusely while watching garba in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday, said police. She was taken to a hospital where she died. According to the victim's father, the doctor suggested a CT scan, which showed a bullet-like metallic object in her skull. Based on the post-mortem report, police said a bullet had hit her.

50.title: 31 people including kids killed in mass shooting at daycare centre in Thailand
50.article_body: At least 31 people including kids have been killed in a mass shooting at a pre-school daycare centre in Thailand, police said. Police added that the attacker, an ex-police officer, shot and stabbed children and adults and is now on the run. Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has alerted all agencies to take action and apprehend the culprit, a spokesperson said.

51.title: Fix for wheel issue that caused electric car recall found: Toyota
51.article_body: Toyota Motor said it has found a fix for the defect because of which it had to recall several units of its first electric vehicle in June. The carmaker recalled 2,700 bZ4X sports utility crossovers globally due to a risk of wheels coming loose. Toyota said it would ensure hub bolts were replaced and properly tightened in new cars.

52.title: Cong leader Udit Raj clarifies 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez, calls it his personal view
52.article_body: Congress leader Udit Raj on Thursday said his remarks on President Droupadi Murmu accusing her of "chamchagiri" were personal and didn't represent his party's views. "My statement...is mine & [has] nothing to do with Congress," part of his tweet read. He had earlier accused her of "chamchagiri" after she said "the salt produced in Gujarat is consumed by all Indians".

53.title: 'Bhoot Police' likely to get a sequel, confirms Saif Ali Khan
53.article_body: Saif Ali Khan has confirmed that the makers of 'Bhoot Police' are "very keen to do a sequel". The film, which had a direct-to-OTT release in 2021, starred Saif with Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam. "I liked my role in Bhoot Police. It continues to be one of the most watched films on that [OTT] platform," Saif said.

54.title: Gujarat youth slashes girl's face after asking if she had an affair
54.article_body: A youth allegedly slashed a 14-year-old girl's face in Gujarat's Surat after asking if she had an affair with someone. Although the girl replied in negative, he attacked her with a knife. The victim had to undergo surgery and got 17 stitches. According to the victim's mother, the accused had been harassing her daughter for the past three months.

55.title: Sydney records wettest year since records began in 1858
55.article_body: Australia's Sydney has recorded its wettest year since records first began in 1858. Sydney has received about 2,213 mm of rainfall since January, surpassing the previous record of 2,194 mm set in 1950, official data showed. In the past two years, floods have struck Sydney's suburbs three times, forcing tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.

56.title: 66 clinics halted abortions in 15 US states after Roe vs Wade overturned: Report
56.article_body: At least 66 clinics in 15 US states have stopped providing abortions since the country's Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade that guaranteed abortion rights to American women, according to the Guttmacher Institute. The number of clinics providing abortions in the 15 states dropped from 79 before June to 13 as of October, all of which are in Georgia.

57.title: Fan breaks down on meeting Dwayne Johnson, actor shares video
57.article_body: Dwayne Johnson shared a video in which a fan couldn't hold back his tears on meeting the Hollywood actor and former wrestler. The video shows Dwayne signing a WWE Championship belt for the fan. "Even my cold, dark soul gets a little emotional when I see people start to break and cry," the actor wrote along with the video.

58.title: Vijay Nair sent to judicial custody till Oct 20 in Delhi liquor policy case
58.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court has sent the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder (OML), Vijay Nair, to judicial custody till October 20 in a Delhi liquor policy case. He was arrested for his alleged role in the irregularities pertaining to the excise policy. Notably, Nair is the communications in-charge of the Aam Aadmi Party.

59.title: We will not rely on others for defence: Taiwan Prez
59.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday said that Taiwan will not rely on others for its defence. "Taiwan is fully committed to protecting our security...We're also working to adapt our defence strategy to the changing threats we face," she added. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

60.title: No country should get Prez like Murmu, 'chamchagiri' has its limits: Cong leader
60.article_body: Congress' Udit Raj said "no country should get President like Droupadi Murmu". "Chamchagiri also has its limits. She says 70% of people eat Gujarat's salt. If you live life by eating salt yourself, you'll know," he tweeted. Earlier, President said Gujarat produces 76% of country's salt and it can be said "salt produced in state is consumed by all Indians".

61.title: Rahkeem Cornwall smashes 205* off 77 balls, including 22 sixes, in 20-over match in US
61.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Rahkeem Cornwall smashed an unbeaten 205 off 77 deliveries, including 22 sixes and 17 fours, while representing Atlanta Fire against Square Drive in an Atlanta Open 2022 match. His knock helped his team post a total of 326/1 in their 20 overs. Atlanta Fire went on to win the match by 172 runs.

62.title: India's tallest flag, higher than Pak flag, to be installed at Wagah-Attari border
62.article_body: The country's tallest flag at 418 feet is set to be installed at the Wagah-Attari border by the National Highways Authority of India, an official said. The present 360-feet high flag was installed in March 2017, following which Pakistan had hoisted a taller flag at Wagah check post. The new Tricolour will be 18 feet longer than the Pakistani flag.

63.title: SpaceX launches 52 Starlink satellites hours after launching Crew-5 mission
63.article_body: SpaceX launched 52 Starlink satellites seven hours after launching members of the Crew-5 mission to the space station on Wednesday. The satellites lifted off atop a Falcon 9 rocket from California's Vandenberg Space Force Base. They were deployed about 62 minutes after liftoff. SpaceX now plans to launch the Intelsat G-33/G-34 mission on October 6.

64.title: Harish Kalyan announces engagement to Narmada Udayakumar, shares pics
64.article_body: Tamil actor Harish Kalyan took to his social media accounts to introduce his fiancee Narmada Udayakumar. Announcing his engagement with Narmada, Harish shared that the two will soon tie the knot. "As we embark on a new life journey to explore and reinvent ourselves together, we seek double the blessings and love from you all, now and always," he wrote.

65.title: Apollo, Sixth Street end talks to finance Musk's Twitter deal: Report
65.article_body: Apollo Global Management and Sixth Street have ended talks with Tesla's Elon Musk to finance his Twitter deal, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo had been looking at ways to support the deal earlier, while Sixth Street investors were looking at providing about $1 billion. Musk has once again proposed to buy Twitter after backing out of a $44-billion deal earlier.

66.title: Former Uber security chief guilty of concealing 2016 data breach
66.article_body: Former Uber security chief Joseph Sullivan has been found guilty of criminal obstruction by a San Francisco jury for concealing a data breach in 2016 from the FTC. Sullivan "worked to hide" the breach from FTC and "took steps to prevent the hackers from being caught", Attorney Stephanie Hinds said. The breach exposed data of 57 million passengers and drivers.

67.title: BMC gives ₹10 cr each to 24 wards for beautification, repair projects
67.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has disbursed ₹10 crore each to all the 24 municipal wards for beautification and repair projects. "BMC has earmarked a total fund of ₹30.5 crore for each ward for carrying out the beautification and repair work on priority. It has disbursed ₹10 crore to complete the pending work, mainly micro-level, at the earliest," an official said.

68.title: Ban 'Adipurush', Lord Ram wrongly depicted in the film: Ayodhya Ram Temple head priest
68.article_body: The head priest of the Ayodhya Ram Temple on Wednesday demanded an immediate ban on the movie 'Adipurush', over the alleged wrong depiction of Lord Ram, Hanuman and Ravana. Making a film is not a crime but they should not be made to create deliberate controversies to hog the limelight, chief priest Satyendra Das said.

69.title: World's oldest dog passes away aged 22
69.article_body: World's oldest dog, Pebbles, passed away from natural causes at her home in Taylors, South Carolina, US with her owners Bobby and Julie Gregory by her side, Guinness World Records said. The Toy Fox Terrier was born on March 28, 2000, in Long Island, New York. Pebbles birthed 32 puppies across three different litters with her late partner, Rocky.

70.title: I see Deepak Chahar being Bumrah's replacement at the T20 WC: Jaffer
70.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he sees pacer Deepak Chahar being Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for Team India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Deepak is getting to play and he is going to play again in the ODIs and it makes sense...He is a quality new-ball bowler, and I do not think he lacks variation," stated Jaffer.

71.title: Tejashwi reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
71.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital to enquire about former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's health. "There is some improvement in his health. He is in CCU. Met with Akhilesh Yadav and gave him my best wishes," Tejashwi Yadav said. Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar also visited the hospital yesterday to check on Singh's health.

72.title: Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings: UP CM Yogi
72.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said the Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings, as the CM fed milk to a leopard cub at Gorakhpur’s Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park. Speaking on the occasion, CM Yogi said human beings will be safe only when they are aware of their responsibilities towards the nature and conservation of animals.

73.title: 2 electrocuted to death in Durga Puja pandal in UP's Barabanki
73.article_body: Two people, including a 17-year-old boy, were electrocuted to death in a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki on Wednesday, said police. Several other people also received electric shocks. The incident occurred after a wire supplying electricity to the pandal was damaged, according to a villager. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

74.title: JSW Energy gains after Maharashtra MoU for hydro pumped storage project
74.article_body: After JSW Energy's wholly-owned subsidiary JSW Neo Energy entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Maharashtra to set up a hydro pumped storage project (PSP) in the state, JSW Energy stock surged on Thursday. It will set up a 960 MW capacity hydro PSP. At 11:45 am, the company's stock was trading 11.85% higher at ₹328 apiece on the NSE.

75.title: Girl raped, murdered in UP's Mainpuri
75.article_body: A girl was allegedly raped and murdered in the Nagla Shisham village of Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district, police said on Wednesday. The victim's younger sister saw the body hanging in the house through the window after returning from coaching. She said a person named Pushpendra strangled her sister to death. Their parents were away at the time of the incident.

76.title: Myanmar jails Japanese filmmaker for 10 years for violating laws
76.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has jailed a 26-year-old Japanese documentary filmmaker, Toru Kubota, for 10 years over violation of sedition and telecommunications laws, a Japanese Foreign Ministry official said. Kubota was arrested in July at a protest in Myanmar's Yangon. A court hearing on allegations of violation of the immigration control law will be held on October 12.

77.title: 26-year-old man arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh in Pune
77.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man, who works at the shop of a cloth trader, with 6.9 grams of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh. This comes after police received a tip-off that a man was trying to sell mephedrone in the Dhankawadi area. "We are looking at the supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," police said.

78.title: Sushmita Sen shares pic showing her look as transgender activist Gauri Sawant
78.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has announced her next web series, 'Taali', where she will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant. "Nothing makes me prouder & more grateful than to have the privilege of portraying this beautiful person & of bringing her story to the world!!" she wrote while sharing her look on Instagram. Marathi filmmaker Ravi Jadhav will direct the series.

79.title: Dean was in tears, Indian team didn't even look her in the eye: Anderson on mankading
79.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said he doesn't see mankading as a "legitimate dismissal" and termed it a "sneaky way of getting someone out". Talking about the controversy over India's Deepti Sharma mankading England's Charlotte Dean, Anderson said, "They did not even look Dean in the eye." He added, "If there was guilt about the dismissal, then don't do it."

80.title: Mayor, 17 others dead as gunmen attack town in southern Mexico
80.article_body: At least 18 people have been killed after gunmen wearing ski masks opened fire in a municipal hall and a house in San Miguel Totolapan town in southern Mexico on Wednesday, local media reported. Among those killed were town's Mayor Conrado Mendoza and his father, Juan Mendoza, a former Mayor. Photos online showed the hall riddled with bullet holes.

81.title: EPF subscribers can't see interest due to software upgrade: Finance Ministry
81.article_body: The Finance Ministry clarified on Wednesday that Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) subscribers haven't suffered any loss of interest rate. "The interest is being credited in the accounts of all EPF subscribers. However, that is not visible in the statements in view of a software upgrade being implemented by EPFO to account for change in the tax incidence," it tweeted.

82.title: Adult toys found in briefcase that caused bomb scare in Japan
82.article_body: Adult toys were found in a briefcase that caused a bomb scare in Japan's Kakegawa. Police received a call on Wednesday morning about the unattended briefcase in the parking lot of a municipal cemetery, a spokesman said. Local media sent a helicopter to capture the work of the experts at the scene.

83.title: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' earns over ₹38 crore worldwide on first day
83.article_body: The team of 'GodFather' announced on Thursday that the film has collected over ₹38 crore at the worldwide box office on the first day of its release. The Mohan Raja directorial, which released on October 5, is a Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. While the original movie starred Mohanlal in the lead role, the Telugu film features Chiranjeevi.

84.title: I’m nervous, but excited: Rihanna on Super Bowl halftime show 2023
84.article_body: Singer-songwriter Rihanna said she's "nervous, but excited" about headlining the next year's Super Bowl halftime show.  Rihanna confirmed the news of her participation in the Super Bowl halftime show with an Instagram post, which was shared on September 26. The performance will mark her first stage presence after welcoming her son with A$AP Rocky.

85.title: Will fight Lok Sabha, Assembly polls with KCR's BRS: Kumaraswamy
85.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that his party JD(S) and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) will fight 2024 Lok Sabha and 2023 Karnataka Assembly elections together. Calling for a 'BJP-Congress mukt' political atmosphere in Karnataka, Kumaraswamy said, "Our party welcomes the emergence of TRS as a national party under the name of BRS."

86.title: Thai firm Translucia picks India's Sunovatech for $3 bn metaverse project
86.article_body: Translucia, a subsidiary of T&B Media Global (Thailand), forayed into India by partnering with Sunovatech to create a $3 billion metaverse project. Sunovatech specialises in immersive reality, while T&B Media is run by the Chearavanont family, counted among Asia's five richest families. Digital asset bank Sygnum, Melbourne-based Two Bulls and Chinese firm Black Flame are part of the alliance.

87.title: 1 charred body found in shop after fire in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar market
87.article_body: A charred body was found in a shop after a fire broke out in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar market on Wednesday evening. "The deceased was 19 years old...was an employee and got stuck inside after fire broke out," a Delhi Fire Services official said. "A total of 28 fire tenders are engaged. Fire is now under control," an official said earlier.

88.title: EU lawmaker cuts her hair during speech in support of Iranian women
88.article_body: European lawmaker Abir Al-Sahlani cut her hair during a speech in the EU Assembly in support of Iranian women protesting against Mahsa Amini's death. Amini died on September 16, days after being detained by Iran's morality police over improper hijab. "Until the women of Iran are free, we're going to stand with you," Iraqi-born Al-Sahlani said before cutting her hair.

89.title: 15-yr-old, 2 others drown in Yamuna during Durga idol immersion in UP
89.article_body: Three people, including a 15-year-old boy, drowned in the Yamuna river during Durga idol immersion in two separate incidents in Agra on Wednesday. While the boy drowned in the Sikandra Police Station area, two others, aged 19 and 22, drowned in the New Agra Police Station area, according to police.

90.title: Won't work for Nitish Kumar even if he vacates CM’s chair for me: Prashant Kishor
90.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Wednesday said he would not work for Bihar CM Nitish Kumar even if he "vacates the CM’s chair" for him. "I categorically told CM...I won't work with him even if he makes me his political heir or vacates the chair of CM for me. I said no….I've made a promise to the people," Kishor added.

91.title: 20-yr-old Indian American student killed in US, roommate arrested for murder called police
91.article_body: A 20-year-old Purdue University student was allegedly killed by his roommate overnight with "multiple sharp force traumatic injuries" at a residence hall on the Indiana campus in US. Varun Manish Chheda was killed allegedly by his 22-year-old roommate who is in police custody. His roommate, Ji Min Sha from Korea, called police to report that Varun was dead.

92.title: SA ODIs opportunity for me to keep momentum going for 2023 WC: Dhawan
92.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan has said the three-match ODI series against South Africa is an opportunity for him to "keep the momentum going" for a place in the 2023 ODI World Cup. "I wish to...keep batting well so that I can make it to the team," he added. Dhawan last played in the Zimbabwe ODIs in August.

93.title: Team India squad departs for Australia for T20 World Cup 2022, BCCI shares pic
93.article_body: Rohit Sharma-led Team India squad departed for Australia on Thursday to take part in T20 World Cup 2022. The BCCI shared a group picture of the contingent ahead of the departure, writing, "Picture perfect...Let's do this Team India...@cricketworldcup here we come." Players also took to their respective social media handles to share pictures from Mumbai airport.

94.title: What is an 'everything app' that Elon Musk wants to make?
94.article_body: An "everything app", often referred to as a "super app", that Elon Musk wants to make has been described as Swiss army knife of mobile apps. An everything app offers a suite of services for users such as messaging, social networking, peer-to-peer payments and e-commerce shopping. "Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app," Musk had tweeted.

95.title: Kohli, ABD are my idols, I've learnt a lot from them at RCB: Rajat Patidar
95.article_body: India batter Rajat Patidar, who received his maiden India call-up for the ODI series against South Africa, has said he has learnt a lot from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers while playing for RCB in IPL. Patidar added, "IPL gave me confidence...I try focusing on [different formats]...play as per the [situation]." The first India-SA ODI will be played today.

96.title: Spotify buys content moderation firm Kinzen to address safety issues
96.article_body: Audio-streaming platform Spotify has acquired an Ireland-based content moderation tech firm Kinzen to address safety issues. Kinzen, which has been working with Spotify since 2020, focuses on election-related content, misinformation and hate speech. Earlier this year, Spotify faced backlash over "The Joe Rogan Experience" in which the podcaster was accused of spreading misinformation on COVID-19.

97.title: General Electric cuts jobs at onshore wind unit amid restructuring: Report
97.article_body: General Electric (GE) is laying off workers at its onshore wind unit as the company plans to restructure and resize the business, a Reuters report said. The company reportedly notified employees in North America, Latin America, the Middle-East and Africa about the job cuts. The layoffs are likely to affect 20% of the onshore wind unit's workforce in the US.

98.title: India reports 2,529 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 32,282
98.article_body: India reported 2,529 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,468 fresh COVID-19 cases. The active cases in the country now stand at 32,282 following 3,553 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.07%.

99.title: 'Doctor G' is one of the funniest scripts Ayushmann & I have read: Rakul
99.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said that she and her co-star Ayushmann Khurrana have often discussed that their upcoming film 'Doctor G' is "one of the funniest scripts" they've read. "This film's beauty is that it's not preachy. Our intention is to entertain everyone," she added. Talking about Ayushmann, Rakul said the actor "comes with an abundance of energy".

100.title: Iranian-made drones hit town near Ukrainian capital for the first time
100.article_body: A town located near Ukrainian capital Kyiv was hit by Iranian-made Shahed-136 delta-wing drones, also known as 'kamikaze drones', local officials said. Governor of the Kyiv region, Oleksiy Kuleba, said six explosions had been heard overnight in Bila Tserkva. Dozens of firefighters and rescue workers tried to extinguish fire and assess damage, Kuleba said, adding that one person was injured.

101.title: Maharashtra will see Sena CM once again: Thackeray at Dussehra rally
101.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said that Maharashtra will see a Shiv Sena Chief Minister again. During the Dussehra rally at Mumbai’s Shivaji Park, former Maharashtra CM Thackeray said, "With your support, I promise you one thing...I will make sure that you will see a Sena Chief Minister once again."

102.title: Partially decomposed body of woman found in gunny bag in Mumbai
102.article_body: A partially decomposed body of a woman, who appeared to be in her mid-20s, was found in a gunny bag in Mumbai's Kurla East on Wednesday. The body, with hands and legs tied with rope, was thrown in a nullah, said police. There were no injury marks on the body except a strangulation mark on the neck, added police.

103.title: 3 men booked for assaulting pet dog and its owner in Bengaluru
103.article_body: Bengaluru's KR Puram Police has booked three men for assaulting a pet dog and its owner. The three men allegedly entered the house of the dog's owner in the Bhattarahalli area and started beating the pet with a stick, police said. This comes after the dog fought with another dog belonging to a man from the victim's neighbourhood.

104.title: Happiest Minds Technologies gets board's nod to raise ₹1,400 cr via equity
104.article_body: The board of Happiest Minds Technologies on Wednesday approved raising of up to ₹1,400 crore through equity or debt bonds. The IT company, which was founded in 2011, reported about 57% surge in consolidated net profit at ₹53.34 crore in the first quarter ended June. Its consolidated revenue from operations was up 34.46% to ₹328.92 crore during the said quarter.

105.title: Man City, Real Madrid secure 3rd straight wins in Champions League, PSG held
105.article_body: Manchester City and Real Madrid defeated Copenhagen and Shakhtar Donetsk respectively in their respective group matches to secure their third straight wins in the Champions League on Wednesday night. PSG, however, were held to a 1-1 draw by Benfica. Notably, Chelsea got their first win in the competition under new coach Graham Potter, defeating AC Milan 3-0.

106.title: Uruli Devachi garbage depot in Pune turned into 'Amrut Van' forest
106.article_body: Once a garbage depot spread over 20 acres, a spot in Pune's Uruli Devachi has been turned into an urban forest, which is expected to be a major tourist attraction in the future. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has named it 'Amrut Van'. It had planted over 20,000 saplings that have grown into 10-foot-tall trees over the past three years.

107.title: Prabhas' 'Adipurush' poster a copy of our work, says animation studio; shares pics
107.article_body: An animation studio has claimed that a poster of 'Adipurush' is a copy of its work. Vaanar Sena Studios shared its own Lord Shiva poster and compared it with 'Adipurush' poster featuring Prabhas and wrote that the producers must at least credit it. "Such a shame, T- Series should mention the original creator, who developed the artwork," the caption read.

108.title: Electronics Mart India IPO subscribed 1.69 times, issue ends tomorrow
108.article_body: Electronics Mart India's IPO was subscribed 1.69 times on October 4, the first day of the subscription. The offer garnered bids for 10.58 crore equity shares against an offer size of 6.25 crore. Friday is the last day of subscription and the company, which is the fourth-largest consumer durables and electronics retailer in India, expects to raise ₹500 crore.

109.title: Sensex gains 473 points, Nifty above 17,400 in opening trade
109.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Thursday with the Sensex rising 473.55 points to 58,539.02 and Nifty up 140 points to 17,414.30. Infosys, Hindalco Industries, Tata Motors, Coal India and SBI Life Insurance were among the major gainers on the Nifty. Stocks of HDFC Limited and Hindustan Unilever Limited slipped. About 1,732 shares advanced and 415 shares declined.

110.title: 8-month-old Indian-origin baby, parents, uncle who were kidnapped in US found dead
110.article_body: The missing Indian-origin family kidnapped from California, US, earlier in the week has been found dead. Police announced that all four family members – eight-month-old Aroohi Dheri and her parents, 27-year-old Jasleen Kaur and 36-year-old Jasdeep Singh, and the baby's 39-year-old uncle Amandeep Singh – were found dead. "Tonight our worst fears have been confirmed," police added.

111.title: Prabhas, Om Raut celebrate Dussehra at Red Fort, perform Ravan Dahan
111.article_body: Actor Prabhas was in Delhi to celebrate Dussehra. The actor performed Ravan Dahan on Wednesday at Red Fort's Ramlila in the presence of his 'Adipurush' director Om Raut and Delhi's Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal. Prabhas will be seen playing Lord Ram in 'Adipurush', which will also star Kriti Sanon as Janaki and Saif Ali Khan as Lankesh.

112.title: Which are the 4 Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about?
112.article_body: The four Indian cough and cold syrups WHO has warned about include Promethazine Oral Solution, Kofexmalin Baby Cough Syrup, Makoff Baby Cough Syrup and Magrip N Cold Syrup. WHO said the manufacturer, Haryana's Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, has not provided guarantees on safety and quality of these products. The syrups have been linked to 66 deaths among children in Gambia.

113.title: Mumbai court discharges man after lab finds baking soda, not drugs
113.article_body: A Mumbai court discharged a man accused in a narcotics case after a forensic lab report showed that the substance seized from him was not any drug but baking soda. The man was accused of carrying 100 grams of mephedrone. The prosecutor opposed the discharge application saying the report was not conclusive but the court allowed it.

114.title: 9, including 5 school children, killed as tourist bus crashes into KSRTC bus in Kerala
114.article_body: At least nine persons, including five school children, were killed and around 40 others were injured after a tourist bus crashed into another bus of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) in Palakkad district on Wednesday night, police said. The deceased also include three passengers of the KSRTC bus and another person a bus employee, police added.

115.title: 4 sanitation workers die while cleaning sewer at Faridabad hospital
115.article_body: At least four sanitation workers, all aged between 25 and 30, died while cleaning a sewer pit at a private hospital in Faridabad on Wednesday, police said. Initially, two workers entered the sewer and fainted after inhaling poisonous gas, police added. "When they didn't return, two more workers went...to rescue them after which they too fell unconscious," police stated.

116.title: 'Ram Setu' features exciting & thrilling action: Akshay Kumar
116.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar shared that his upcoming film 'Ram Setu' features some "exciting and thrilling" action sequences, which gave him an adrenaline rush after a long time. He also informed that the film's trailer will release on October 11. Directed by Abhishek Sharma, 'Ram Setu' marks Akshay's fourth release this year after 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Samrat Prithviraj' and 'Raksha Bandhan'.

117.title: SA ODIs will help T20 WC standby players to get into groove: Dhawan
117.article_body: India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan has said the three-match ODI series against South Africa will help the standby players for the upcoming T20 World Cup to get into the groove. "Who knows they might get a chance...look at this series as preparation," stated Dhawan. Shreyas Iyer, Ravi Bishnoi and Deepak Chahar are the standbys who will feature in SA ODIs.

118.title: Hyderabad Police arrests man for cheating clients through dating app
118.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police has arrested a man from Delhi for allegedly cheating clients through a dating app named Gigolo Playboy Services. The accused set up call centres and hired some girls to talk to the clients through the app, luring them to transfer money, said police. The complainant, one of the clients, transferred over ₹1.5 crore.

119.title: 8 die, several feared missing after flash floods in WB during idol immersion; video surfaces
119.article_body: At least eight people died and several others are feared missing after flash floods hit Mal river in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri during Durga Puja idol immersion. The video of the incident has surfaced online. "We've rescued around 50 people," DM Moumita Godara said. Expressing his condolences PM Narendra Modi said, "Anguished by the mishap during Durga Puja festivities in Jalpaiguri."

120.title: Jaya shouts at fans taking pics with Abhishek during temple visit, video surfaces
120.article_body: A video shows actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry and shouting at fans taking selfies with Abhishek Bachchan during a temple visit in Bhopal. While Abhishek can be seen obliging some of the fans, Jaya can be seen shouting asking them to stay away. "Don't you have no shame?" she can be heard saying in the video.

121.title: 'Thank God' is first script I heard from start to finish: Sidharth
121.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said the script of 'Thank God' is the first script that he heard from the beginning to the end. The actor, who is looking forward to the film's release, said the Indra Kumar directorial is a "relatable story" and has a "wonderful message by the end". The comedy film also stars Ajay Devgn and Rakul Preet Singh.

122.title: Sonia Gandhi to join Congress’ 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Karnataka today
122.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi will participate in the party’s 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Thursday in Karnataka. This will be her first participation in the yatra, which began while she was abroad for a medical check-up. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday. The yatra will pass through Karnataka for 21 days covering 511 km in the state.

123.title: Video shows the moment man kidnaps 4 Indian-origin people, including 8-month-old, in US
123.article_body: The authorities in US released a video showing the moment four members of an Indian-origin family, including an 8-month-old baby, were kidnapped in US' California. The video shows two family members, Jasdeep Singh and Amandeep Singh, being forced out of building with hands zip-tied together. The video later shows the gun-wielding kidnapper leading Jasleen Kaur and her baby into truck.

124.title: Putin orders his government to take control of Europe's largest nuclear plant
124.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday ordered his government to take control of Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, Europe's largest. Russia captured it shortly after invading Ukraine, but Ukrainian staff have continued to operate it. Meanwhile, the chief of Ukraine's state energy agency announced he was taking over the plant.

125.title: North Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles in direction of Japan
125.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles into the sea in the direction of Japan on Thursday. This comes after the return of US aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan to the region and a UN Security Council meeting in response to North Korea's recent launches. North Korea said the aircraft carrier posed serious threat to the stability of the situation.

126.title: Nigerian regulator sues Meta, seeks $70 mn fine for 'showing unvetted ads'
126.article_body: The Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON) has filed a lawsuit against Meta and sought $70 million fine for "publishing unauthorised ads". "The continued publication and exposure of various advertisements directed at Nigerian market through Facebook and Instagram...by Meta...without ensuring the same is vetted and approved before exposure is illegal, unlawful," the court filings said.

127.title: Mumbai man misbehaves with daughter-in-law, seeks sexual favours; jailed
127.article_body: A Mumbai court has sentenced a 65-year-old man to three-year rigorous imprisonment for inappropriately touching his daughter-in-law and asking her for sexual favours. He'd asked his daughter-in-law to engage in a particular sexual behaviour with him, as per a pandit's advice, to solve problems happening in their home. The woman had gotten married to his son a few months earlier.

128.title: 24-yr-old delivery rider lies about being robbed in Delhi; arrested
128.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery rider was arrested for allegedly hatching a conspiracy about being robbed in Delhi's Neb Sarai, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he was held at gunpoint and was robbed of ₹31,000, a police official said. The accused hatched the plan after delivering a phone in Neb Sarai, DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary said.

129.title: Ex-driver kills 86-yr-old woman, robs her of ₹3 lakh in Delhi
129.article_body: An 86-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death by her ex-driver, who entered her house and escaped with ₹3,20,000, police said on Wednesday. The accused revealed during interrogation that he was aware of the money, said DCP (outer) Sameer Sharma, adding that he roamed near the house with a knife all day and later stabbed the victim.

130.title: 'Want a casteless society': Thousands of Dalits convert to Buddhism in Delhi
130.article_body: Several thousand Dalits from Delhi-NCR on Wednesday reportedly converted to Buddhism at an event attended by Delhi Cabinet Minister Rajendra Gautam. "[We want]...a casteless society...We don't want our children to be murdered for drinking water from...pots [or] keeping a moustache," one of the attendees told reporters. The event was held at Ambedkar Bhavan in Delhi's Jhandewalan area.

131.title: Thane woman forges marriage papers to get properties worth ₹19 cr, held
131.article_body: A Thane woman was arrested along with two others for allegedly forging her marriage certificate to get ownership of movable and immovable assets worth ₹19 crore belonging to her deceased husband. Anjali Agarwal reportedly forced her husband, Anil Papde, to sign the certificate by threatening to tell everyone about his HIV diagnosis. Agarwal and her accomplices were arrested on Monday.

132.title: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeat Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings to win LLC 2022
132.article_body: Gautam Gambhir-led India Capitals defeated Irfan Pathan-led Bhilwara Kings by 104 runs in the final to win Legends League Cricket 2022. Batting first, India Capitals posted a total of 211/7 despite being 21/4 at one stage. Ross Taylor top-scored for India Capitals with 82(41). Bhilwara Kings were bowled out for 107 in 18.2 overs.

133.title: 4 killed as suicide bomber targets Afghan Interior Ministry mosque
133.article_body: At least four people were killed after a suicide bomber struck a mosque inside the Taliban-controlled Afghan Interior Ministry in Kabul on Wednesday. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Wednesday's attack follows last week's suicide bombing in Kabul which claimed 35 lives, according to the United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

134.title: Turkey to send troops to Qatar for football World Cup security
134.article_body: The Turkish Parliament on Wednesday approved sending its soldiers to Qatar for helping in security arrangements during the football World Cup next month. Former Turkish Defence Minister Fikri Isik said the deployment would include 250 troops and a naval vessel. Further, Turkey has already assured it will send around 3,000 riot police personnel to Qatar during the international competition.

135.title: Completely untrue: Brad Pitt's representative on claims that he choked one of his kids
135.article_body: A representative for Brad Pitt has denied Angelina Jolie's allegations that he choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016, stating they are "completely untrue". Jolie had also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

136.title: WI's Kyle Mayers smashes 105-metre six over cover, cricketers react as video  goes viral
136.article_body: West Indies' Kyle Mayers slammed a 105-metre six over cover during the first T20I against Australia. Reacting to a viral video of the shot, former India opener Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "You are not allowed to do this!" Meanwhile, Adam Gilchrist wrote, "I'm sure there has been a better shot in the history of the game...but I just can't remember it!"

137.title: Our rebellion was not betrayal, but a revolt: Shinde on Shiv Sena split
137.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that the rebellion by him and other Shiv Sena leaders which led to the split in the party wasn't an act of betrayal, but a revolt. He said voters elected Shiv Sena and the BJP in 2019 in Maharashtra, but Uddhav Thackeray betrayed people by joining hands with the Congress and the NCP.

138.title: Indian-origin Vivek Murthy to represent US on WHO Executive Board
138.article_body: Indian-origin Dr Vivek Murthy has been nominated by US President Joe Biden to serve as the country's representative on the World Health Organisation's (WHO) Executive Board. The White House said Dr Murthy will continue his duties as the US Surgeon General alongside his new position. In March 2021, Dr Murthy was confirmed the US' 21st Surgeon General.

139.title: India, EFTA bloc mull resumption of talks on free trade deal: Reports
139.article_body: According to sources, India and the European Free Trade Association (EFTA), which consists of Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway and Switzerland, are planning to resume the negotiations on a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) after a gap of several years. According to officials, Switzerland has been in talks with India for the FTA. India's total trade with EFTA during 2021-22 was $27.23 billion.

140.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for September as 3 Indians included?
140.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of September. Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan, Australia's Cameron Green and India's Axar Patel have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while India's Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana, and Bangladesh's Nigar Sultana have been nominated in the women's category.

141.title: Some became 'Kattappa', betrayed us when I was in hospital: Uddhav
141.article_body: During the Dussehra rally at Mumbai's Shivaji Park, former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray called the rebel Shiv Sena leaders "Kattappa", a character from 'Baahubali' franchise. He said, "The only thing I feel bad and angry about is that when I was admitted to the hospital, the people whom I gave the responsibility (of the state) became 'Kattappa' and betrayed us."

142.title: Ukraine takes first step towards joining OECD economic group
142.article_body: Ukraine took its first step towards joining the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) after the OECD said it could be a prospective member. Secretary General Mathias Cormann said the OECD's 38 members have decided to recognise Ukraine as a prospective member following a request from Kyiv. OECD closed Russia's accession process after it invaded Ukraine in February.

143.title: Video shows new 70,000-square feet Hindu temple inaugurated in Dubai
143.article_body: Industrialist Anand Mahindra shared the video of the Hindu Temple of Dubai, which was officially inaugurated on Wednesday. "I believe this magnificent temple was formally inaugurated today. Auspicious timing. Will make sure to visit it on my next trip to Dubai," he wrote. The 70,000-square feet temple, located in Jebel Ali, has 16 deities.

144.title: EU agrees to impose price cap for Russian oil over Ukraine war
144.article_body: EU officials said that member nations have agreed to impose a price cap on Russian oil and other sanctions after Moscow annexed four Ukrainian regions. The deal includes curbs on exports of aircraft components to Russia and limits on steel imports. EU will also ban the transport of Russian oil by sea to other countries above the price cap.

145.title: Fan mocks Pakistan's Shadab Khan over tweet, asks him to focus on World Cup; he responds
145.article_body: A fan mocked Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan over his tweet thanking his teammate Iftikhar Ahmad for birthday wish. "Ye shaddy shoody k chakr choro and please focus on World Cup," the fan wrote. Shadab, who's currently in New Zealand, responded, "It's late night in NZ...Physio has asked us to rest...Should I hang upside down and start training if you want?"

146.title: Video of boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit goes viral, PM says 'Heartening to see'
146.article_body: A video of a boy doing cricket commentary in Sanskrit during a gully cricket match has gone viral on social media. Prime Minister Narendra Modi also shared the video, tweeting, "This is heartening to see…Congrats to those undertaking this effort." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "What lovely flow and spontaneity. Sanskrit is a great language."

147.title: I am under house arrest: Ex-J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti
147.article_body: Former CM of erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday claimed she was under house arrest and was stopped from travelling to Pattan. “Was finally allowed to leave my residence only because the HM (Amit Shah) has headed back to Delhi,” she later tweeted. Meanwhile, Srinagar Police said “no restriction of any kind” was placed on Mufti’s travel plan.

148.title: Lee releases video on how cricketers should avoid injuries, says 'Ice baths are rubbish'
148.article_body: Ex-Australia fast bowler Brett Lee released a video on how cricketers should avoid injuries. Lee said that fast bowlers should not lift heavy weights as lean muscle mass is key. He also criticised ice baths which are used for recovery in modern-day cricket. Calling ice baths "rubbish", he stated, "There is no scientific evidence to prove that they work."

149.title: Fire breaks out at cloth market in Delhi, 35 fire tenders on spot
149.article_body: A fire broke out at a cloth market in Delhi's Gandhi Nagar on Wednesday. No casualties have been reported so far, fire department officials said. As many as 35 fire tenders reached the spot after receiving a call about the fire in the evening. As per reports, the fire tenders had to be parked far away due to narrow lanes.

150.title: IIT-Delhi's curriculum set for complete revamping: Director
150.article_body: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi's new Director, Rangan Banerjee, said the institute's curriculum is set for a total revamping after over a decade. A panel has been formed to review the curriculum of all courses, Banerjee told PTI. "We are trying to provide in our curriculum, challenges and opportunities...hence a complete revamp was needed," he said.

151.title: India supported 85% of its rural households during the pandemic: WB
151.article_body: World Bank (WB) President David Malpass on Wednesday praised the Indian government’s support to the poor during the COVID-19 pandemic, specifically lauding India's targeted cash transfer programme. Malpass said, "Helped by digital cash transfers, India managed to provide food or cash support to a remarkable 85% of rural households." He urged other nations to adopt similar measures.

152.title: Apollo Hospitals acquires 60% stake in AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore
152.article_body: Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Ltd has acquired a 60% stake in Ayurveda hospital chain AyurVAID for ₹26.4 crore, PTI reported. The investment will reportedly be used to upgrade existing centres and for digital health initiatives. Apollo Hospitals Enterprise Chairman Prathap C Reddy said the Apollo-AyurVAID partnership will be a beacon of hope for Indians and medical value travellers around the world.

153.title: Tamil Nadu govt invites Czech aircraft manufacturer to invest in state
153.article_body: Tamil Nadu government said that the state has invited Czech Republic-based light aircraft manufacturer Evektor Aircraft to invest in the state. Minister for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, TM Anbarasan, was explained the investment opportunities available in their country by the senior government officials during his visit to the MSV International Engineering Fair in Czech Republic.

154.title: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa decide to call off divorce after 9 months: Report
154.article_body: Dhanush and Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who announced their separation in January earlier this year, have decided to put their divorce on hold, as per several reports. According to reports, the families of both parties met at Rajinikanth's home and agreed that they should work on their marriage. Dhanush got married to Aishwaryaa, Rajinikanth's eldest daughter, in 2004.

155.title: Sonia Gandhi offers prayers at Karnataka temple on Dussehra
155.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi visited the Bheemanakolli temple in Begur village of Karnataka's Mysuru on Wednesday to offer prayers on the occasion of Dussehra. She was accompanied by village panchayat members and local MLA Anil Kumar C. The Congress leader is in Karnataka for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which will commence on Thursday after a two-day break for Dussehra.

156.title: SpaceX & NASA launch crew of 4, including a Russian cosmonaut, to ISS
156.article_body: SpaceX on Wednesday launched its Crew Dragon capsule from NASA's Kennedy Space Centre in US' Florida to take two American and one Japanese astronaut and one Russian cosmonaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The capsule was launched using SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket at 9:30 pm (IST). The rocket's reusable lower-stage booster landed back safely on a drone recovery vessel.

157.title: Amit Shah visits Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in J&K's Srinagar
157.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah visited Gurudwara Chatti Patshahi in Rainawari area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Wednesday, officials said. He was accompanied by Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha and some BJP leaders. Earlier on Wednesday, Shah addressed a public rally in Kashmir's Baramulla and later visited the family members of a slain policeman in Uri.

158.title: 1 worker killed, 7 injured as elevator crashes at textile factory in Surat
158.article_body: A 35-year-old worker was killed and seven others were injured after a goods elevator crashed from the third floor of a textile factory in Surat on Wednesday. According to police, the cable snapped and lift crashed down 30 feet. "Among the seven injured, condition of five is serious as they suffered multiple fractures," CMO of New Civil Hospital said.

159.title: UP CM Adityanath feeds leopard cub with milk bottle at Gorakhpur zoo
159.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday inspected Gorakhpur's Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park, where he also fed milk to a leopard cub. A video released by the state government showed Adityanath cradling the cub and feeding it with a milk bottle while wearing rubber gloves. MP Ravi Kishan, veterinarians and zoo officials were also present at the scene.

160.title: OPEC+ panel agrees to cut oil production by 2 million barrels/day
160.article_body: The panel of OPEC+ ministers on Wednesday agreed to cut oil production in member countries by two million barrels/day. The supply-cut could cause a rise in crude oil prices that have dropped to about $90/barrel from $120/barrel three months ago on fears of a global recession. United States of America had suggested OPEC to not proceed with the cuts.

161.title: WHO warns against taking 4 Indian cough, cold syrups after 66 kids die in Gambia
161.article_body: The WHO on Wednesday warned using four cough and cold syrups that are potentially linked to acute kidney injuries and 66 deaths among children in Gambia. The four contaminated syrups are produced by Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited, in India, the WHO said. "WHO recommends all countries detect and remove these products from circulation," the organization added.

162.title: Elon Musk, Twitter yet to reach deal to end lawsuit: Report
162.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk and Twitter have not yet reached an agreement to end the lawsuit and execute the latter's $44-billion takeover by Musk, Reuters reported. This comes after Musk proposed to go ahead with the deal he proposed in April if Twitter dropped its lawsuit against him. Twitter and Musk's lawyers said they're attempting to try to overcome mutual distrust.

163.title: Anubhav Sinha was supposed to launch me in B'wood: Sidharth Malhotra
163.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who made his debut in Karan Johar's 'Student Of The Year', revealed that he was to be launched in Bollywood by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha. "The film wasn't 'Fashion', but he (Anubhav) was the director who was supposed to launch me and two other actors," he stated. Sidharth added that the film didn't take off for various reasons.

164.title: You're a bully & a joke: Gigi on Kanye West insulting Vogue editor
164.article_body: Model Gigi Hadid has reacted after Kanye West insulted Vogue editor Gabriella Karefa-Johnson after she criticised Kanye's 'White Lives Matter' t-shirts. In a now-deleted Instagram post, Kanye had posted Gabriella's picture and wrote, "This is not a fashion person." Reacting to Kanye's post, Gigi commented, "You wish you had a percentage of her intellect...You're a bully and a joke."

165.title: 3 persons of a family electrocuted to death in Odisha's Boudh
165.article_body: Three persons of a family died of electrocution at their residence in Odisha's Boudh, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday when one of the deceased, Sukanti Behera, was hanging a wet cloth on a wire which accidentally came in contact with another live wire. Her son and brother-in-law were also electrocuted while trying to save her, police said.

166.title: DMK not against spiritualism, but against mixing religion with politics: TN CM
166.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday said the DMK is not against spiritualism but is against using religion for political and selfish gains. "Those using religion for their political survival allege that...Dravidian model of governance is against religion and beliefs," he said. He also accused his detractors of launching a disinformation campaign against him and his party.

167.title: 5 people drown during Durga idol immersion in Rajasthan's Ajmer
167.article_body: Five people drowned in a ditch filled with rainwater during the immersion of Goddess Durga idol in Rajasthan's Ajmer on Wednesday, police said. "They thought it was a shallow ditch and went down," SHO Hemraj said. The deceased were identified as 35-year-old Pawan Raigar, 28-year-old Gajendra Raigar, 24-year-old Rahul Meghwal, 21-year-old Lucky Bairwa and 20-year-old Rahul Raigar.

168.title: IAF deploys 2 helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in Uttarakhand
168.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has deployed two helicopters to save mountaineers trapped in snow after an avalanche hit Draupadi ka Danda-2 mountain peak in Uttarakhand. The helicopters were deployed from Uttar Pradesh. A video shared by the IAF showed a helicopter hovering over the avalanche-hit peak. As per reports, 14 people from the mountaineering team were rescued on Wednesday.

169.title: Asteroid hit by NASA leaves 10,000 km trail of debris; pic surfaces
169.article_body: An asteroid that was deliberately hit by NASA on September 26 has left an expanding, comet-like trail of debris stretching 10,000 kilometres, a picture showed. The picture was taken two days after the impact by astronomers in Chile. On September 26, NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test aircraft hit the asteroid in NASA's first attempt to move an asteroid in space.

170.title: India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings increase by 4.6% in August
170.article_body: According to data from the RBI, India Inc's foreign commercial borrowings in August this year increased by nearly 4.6% to $2.98 billion. Over $2.47 billion of the total borrowings was through the automatic route of raising funds from foreign sources. While over $502.79 million was raised by way of issuing rupee denominated bonds (RDBs) or masala bonds.

171.title: Shah gets his bulletproof shield removed at Baramulla rally, video surfaces
171.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah had his bullet-proof glass shield removed from the podium before addressing a public rally in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla on Wednesday. He stated that he wanted to directly connect with the people and didn't want any sort of interruption. Shah embarked on a three-day visit to the union territory on October 3.

172.title: India will overtake US as Unilever's 'largest business': HUL CEO
172.article_body: During an interview, Hindustan Unilever's (HUL) CEO and MD Sanjiv Mehta said that India will overtake the US as Unilever's 'largest business'. "I clearly see a day when HUL will become the largest Unilever business," he said, adding that he could not give a timeframe. According to company data, HUL currently accounts for about 10.7% of Unilever group sales.

173.title: Gazprom resumes gas exports to Italy via Austria
173.article_body: Russian energy giant Gazprom said it has resumed gas exports to Italy via Austria on Wednesday after resolving an issue over guarantees. Gazprom said regulatory changes in Austria had made it possible to resume the exports.
