Italian energy group Eni confirmed that supplies had resumed, adding that it expected only part of the gas requested to arrive on Wednesday.

174.title: WTO forecasts further trade growth slowdown in 2023
174.article_body: The World Trade Organisation (WTO) has predicted a sharp slowdown of global goods trade growth next year as increasing energy prices, interest rates and food and fertiliser bills have curbed import demand. It said that 2023 could see a trade growth of just 1%. WTO provided a band of growth expansion of 2.0%-4.9% for 2022 and -2.8%-4.6% for 2023.

175.title: Man gets new look after robbing ₹12 crore from bank, caught in Pune 2 months later
175.article_body: Police have arrested the main accused involved in the ₹12 crore cash theft from ICICI Bank in Thane's Manpada area from Pune after more than two-and-a-half months, an official said. The accused, Altaf Shaikh, had been working with ICICI Bank as a custodian. After the incident, he escaped and would change his looks and use burqa to hide his identity.

176.title: SWIFT lays out blueprint for global central bank digital currency network
176.article_body: Financial messaging system SWIFT has laid out its blueprint for a global central bank digital currency network following an eight-month-long experiment on different technologies and currencies. The experiment included 14 central and commercial banks, connected to SWIFT's main hub, said SWIFT's head of innovation Nick Kerigan. The experiment will be followed by more advanced testing over next year.

177.title: JSW Energy to install 960 MW hydro pump storage project in Maharashtra
177.article_body: JSW Energy has signed an agreement with the Maharashtra government to establish a 960-megawatt hydro pump storage project in Raigarh district. JSW's statement said that hydro pump storage is a well-established technology that provides adequate peaking power reserves, reliable grid operation, energy balancing and storage capacity. JSW did not reveal any financial details of the project.

178.title: Govt plans to auction 22 mineral blocks in next 2 months
178.article_body: The government is planning to auction 22 mineral blocks in Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh and Goa in November and December. The mines include six iron-ore blocks, three each of limestone and gold, two bauxite blocks, and one each of copper, phosphorite and glauconite. The Ministry of Mines has expressed hopes of auctioning 500 mines by the end of 2024.

179.title: I've read reviews where people said to not work with Hrithik: Saif
179.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan said working in 'Vikram Vedha' was exhausting as he wanted to perform well with Hrithik Roshan. "Hrithik is not entirely human or normal...there's something so incredibly gifted about his presence...ability to...pull the eye to everything he's doing," Saif added. Saif stated he's read reviews where people said to not work with Hrithik "because it'll destroy you".

180.title: Govt sets up two advisory committees to resolve challenges in steel industry
180.article_body: The Ministry of Steel said that it has established two advisory committees, one each for the ISPs and the secondary sector to iron out the challenges in the steel industry. The ministry said the committees aim to achieve the target of 300 million tonne of production capacity by 2030. Several meetings of the committee have been held since their formation.

181.title: Central bank monetary tightening will prevent entrenched inflation: IMF
181.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said that recent monetary tightening by many central banks globally will prevent entrenched inflation. "Front-loaded monetary policy tightening...can lower the risk that inflation will become de-anchored from its target," it said. Recently, RBI raised its repo rate by 50 bps to 5.90%. Earlier, US Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 75 basis points.

182.title: 'Ravan is different this year': Uddhav to Maha CM Shinde on Dussehra
182.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday called the rebel Eknath Shinde camp "traitors", adding that the "stain on them will remain forever". While addressing a gathering from Shivaji Park on Dussehra, Thackeray said that we burn Ravan every year, but this year "Ravan is different". Shinde faction's rally was held at the MMRDA ground in Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC).

183.title: 4 of family killed as LPG cylinder explodes at their home in UP
183.article_body: Four members of a family, including a 10-month-old, were killed and two were injured after an LPG cylinder exploded at their house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Wednesday. Police said the incident took place due to leakage in the cylinder pipe. The wall of their two-storey house collapsed due to the blast.

184.title: Thought this is how B'wood is after 'English...', later met a*sholes: Sumit
184.article_body: Actor Sumit Vyas, speaking about 'English Vinglish', said that it was his first time working in a fully commercial film setup. He added that film's director Gauri Shinde, producer R Balki and Sridevi were grounded. Sumit stated he felt everyone in the film industry was like this. "But of course later, I met a bunch of a*sholes," he jokingly added.

185.title: Amit Shah pauses speech after hearing 'Azaan' from nearby mosque in Baramulla, video viral
185.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah today briefly stopped his speech during a rally in Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir as 'Azaan' was going on in a nearby mosque. People in the gathering applauded Shah for his gesture. After a while, he said the call for the prayer has now stopped and asked the crowd if he could continue his speech.

186.title: Jasprit Bumrah shares Winston Churchill quote aimed at his critics
186.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022 due to back injury, took to Instagram Stories to share a quote aimed at his critics. Bumrah used the quote originally said by ex-UK PM Winston Churchill. The quote read, "You'll never reach your destination if you stop and throw stones at every dog that barks."

187.title: Ajinkya Rahane, wife Radhika blessed with a baby boy
187.article_body: Cricketer Ajinkya Rahane and his wife Radhika Rahane have been blessed with their second child, a baby boy. "Both Radhika and the baby are doing well and are completely healthy. We'd like to thank you for all your love and blessings," Ajinkya wrote on Instagram. Ajinkya and Radhika were blessed with their first child, daughter Aarya, in October 2019.

188.title: If Ravan's effigy is burnt, Ram's will go up in flames too: Dalit Sena in K'taka
188.article_body: Dalit Sena on Wednesday said if the effigy of Ravan is burnt, the effigy of Lord Ram will go up in flames too. Dalit Sena is opposing Hindu groups organising burning of a 50-foot-tall Ravan effigy in Appa Jatra ground in Karnataka's Kalaburagi on occasion of Vijayadashami (Dussehra). They've claimed the programme is being held without permission from authorities.

189.title: Speeding truck mows down 7 in J'khand; 2 women, 1 child among 5 killed
189.article_body: A speeding truck mowed down seven people in Jharkhand's Ramgarh, leading to the death of five people, including two women and one child who died on the spot. All seven people were waiting to hire a vehicle on Ramgarh-Patratu state highway. The truck driver fled the spot, leaving behind his vehicle. Locals blocked the highway seeking action against the driver.

190.title: Oscar-winning actress Juliette Binoche cuts her hair in support of Iranian women
190.article_body: Oscar-winning French actress Juliette Binoche cut her hair in support of Iranian women protesting the death of Mahsa Amini after her arrest by Iranian morality police for allegedly not wearing hijab properly. In an Instagram video, she and some other actresses were seen cutting their hair. "In solidarity for freedom rights for Iranian women and men," Juliette captioned the video.

191.title: Pakistan's General Bajwa meets US Defense Secretary at Pentagon
191.article_body: Pakistan's Chief of the Army Staff, General Qamar Javed Bajwa, met US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin in the Pentagon on Tuesday. General Bajwa thanked the US for extending help to flood-affected Pakistan. General Bajwa's visit to the US comes weeks before he is set to retire. The Pakistani government is yet to announce General Bajwa's successor.

192.title: Protesters disrupt UK PM Truss’ speech at Conservative Party meet
192.article_body: Liz Truss' first speech as UK Prime Minister at the annual conference of the Conservative Party was interrupted by Greenpeace protesters in Birmingham on Wednesday. During Truss' speech, two female protesters stood up, holding a banner which read, "Who voted for this?", referring to Truss becoming the party leader last month. The protesters were escorted out by security personnel.

193.title: 2 try to smuggle ₹68.45 lakh-gold at Hyd airport in separate incidents
193.article_body: Two persons were arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in separate incidents and gold worth ₹68.45 lakh was recovered. In one incident, a male passenger arriving from Bangkok tried to smuggle 865.6 grams of gold worth ₹46.05 lakh. In another incident, a woman tried to smuggle 435 grams of gold worth ₹22.40 lakh.

194.title: PM Modi blows traditional 'Ransingha' during rally in Himachal
194.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his visit to Himachal Pradesh played a Ransingha, a trumpet-like traditional instrument, gifted by CM Jai Ram Thakur on Wednesday. PM Modi then said, "This marks the beginning of each future victory." He addressed a public rally at the Luhnu ground after inaugurating the AIIMS Bilaspur hospital and a hydro-engineering college.

195.title: Burning Ravana effigy falls on spectators at Dussehra event in Haryana; video surfaces
195.article_body: Some people were reportedly injured after a burning effigy of Ravana fell on them during Dussehra celebrations in Haryana's Yamunanagar on Wednesday. A video shows the presence of a massive crowd at the incident site. In the video, people can be seen running as soon as the effigy of Ravana collapses on the ground.

196.title: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya serves food at Durga Puja pandal, shares video
196.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda helped serve food to devotees as she visited a Durga Puja pandal. Sharing a video, she wrote on Instagram, "Subho Bijoya Dashami." In the clip, she can be seen serving chutney and dancing at the pandal. Commenting on the post, her mother Shweta Bachchan Nanda wrote, "I'm sure you made Deedu...so happy."

197.title: KKR to buy TPG Capital stake in Manipal Health Enterprises: Report
197.article_body: US private equity giant Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co LP (KKR) is in an advanced stage of negotiations to buy out the stake of TPG Capital in Manipal Health Enterprises, Moneycontrol reported quoting sources. This comes over a month after KKR reportedly sold its 27.5% stake in Max Healthcare hospital chain for over ₹9,000 crore in August.

198.title: Kerala police officer suspended from duty over alleged links with PFI
198.article_body: A Kerala police officer has been suspended over his alleged links with Popular Front of India (PFI), authorities confirmed. An order issued by the Ernakulam (rural) District Police stated that the concerned police officer tried to meet PFI activists under custody at Perumbavoor police station without the permission or knowledge of his superiors. Centre has banned PFI for five years.

199.title: Javed Akhtar, I know you to be feminist: Sona on #MeToo accused Sajid
199.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra questioned lyricist Javed Akhtar's silence over #MeToo accused Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation. "Dear Javed, I know you to be a veteran, feminist and thought leader of the Indian film industry...you choose to...remain silent all these years about these men you know...well," she tweeted. Sona added she's hurt by Javed's silence and it breaks her heart.

200.title: Want to be in 'Mahabharat', Karna's character appeals to me: Saif
200.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan has said that he would like to act in 'Mahabharat' if it is made like 'The Lord of the Rings'. "We've been talking about that with Ajay Devgn since 'Kachche Dhaage' in our generation, it's the dream subject," he added. Saif added Karna's character in 'Mahabharat' is "more appealing" to him. Saif plays Raavan in 'Adipurush'.

201.title: GST collection in Punjab crosses ₹10,000-crore mark for first time in H1 FY23
201.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema said the state's GST collection crossed the ₹10,000-crore mark for the first time in the first six months of FY23. Punjab has seen a 22.6% YoY growth in GST collection so far in FY23, Cheema added. Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government had estimated a total GST collection of ₹20,550 crore for FY23, he said.

202.title: Wrote to you about ₹6,000-cr MCD scam, you didn't pay heed: Sisodia to L-G
202.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has accused L-G VK Saxena of not ordering an investigation into an alleged ₹6,000-crore scam in Delhi's municipal body that Sisodia claimed he'd written to Saxena about. "You got CBI raids conducted at my house...[and gained] nothing," he added. This comes after Saxena said a probe will be conducted on AAP's power subsidy scheme.

203.title: 24-yr-old delivery rider lies about being robbed in Delhi; arrested
203.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery rider was arrested for allegedly hatching a conspiracy about being robbed in Delhi's Neb Sarai, police said on Wednesday. The accused told the police that he was held at gunpoint and was robbed of ₹31,000, a police official said. The accused hatched the plan after delivering a phone in Neb Sarai, DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary said.

204.title: Cholera disease is making an unwelcome comeback: WHO
204.article_body: The WHO's Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Wednesday said, "Another disease making an unwelcome comeback is cholera." He added, "In the first 9 months of this year, 27 countries have reported cholera outbreaks." He also said that the data shows the average case fatality rate so far this year is almost three times the rate of the past five years.

205.title: Madhya Pradesh board Class 10 & 12 exams to be held from Feb 15
205.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education (MPBSE) has announced that the Class 10 and 12 board exams will be held from February 15 to March 20, 2023. The state School Education Department said that the complete schedule will be available to students soon. The exam dates were shared by School Education Department on its official Twitter handle.

206.title: 36-yr-old Divya Nettimi world's first woman to start a $1-billion hedge fund
206.article_body: US-based Divya Nettimi has started her own hedge fund Avala Global with over $1 billion in commitments, making it the largest launch of a woman-led firm in the industry, Bloomberg said. The 36-year-old portfolio manager earlier oversaw over $4 billion at Viking Global Investors. She'll be betting on and against stocks in the consumer, technology, business services and telecom sectors.

207.title: NEP 2020 aims at creating global citizens: Dharmendra Pradhan
207.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said the National Education Policy (NEP) is not only for the Indian society but its implementation would create global citizens for the 21st century. Inaugurating an international conference of Indian School Psychology Association in Puducherry, he said that NEP envisages the vision of stalwarts like Aurobindo, Mahatma Gandhi and Swami Vivekananda.

208.title: DMK taking credit for projects started during AIADMK rule: EPS
208.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday accused the DMK government of taking credit for projects introduced during his rule. "The current government, since the day it assumed charge, has been functioning in a lethargic manner," Palaniswami said. "The AIADMK government announced 11 medical colleges and a law college, but the DMK government took credit...[by] inaugurating it," he added.

209.title: Man cuts birthday cake with machete in TN, held after video surfaces
209.article_body: The Coimbatore Police have arrested four people for cutting a cake with a machete. The incident came to light after a video of the incident went viral on social media. In the video, a man can be seen cutting the cake with the machete, while his friends sing and wish him. The incident took place on September 25, reports said.

210.title: Shinde quotes Harivansh Rai Bachchan to claim Bal Thackeray's legacy
210.article_body: Ahead of his Dussehra rally, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde tweeted Harivansh Rai Bachchan's couplet to claim the legacy of Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray. The tweet read, "My son, being my son will not be my heir, whoever will be my heir, will be my son." Shinde and Bal Thackeray's son Uddhav Thackeray are heading rival factions of Shiv Sena.

211.title: Iranian singer, who supported female protesters, released on bail
211.article_body: Shervin Hajipour, an Iranian singer who was recently jailed for one of his songs in support of the ongoing protests in the country, was released on bail on Tuesday. Hajipour's song 'Baraye' had received millions of views on Twitter. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police.

212.title: Allahabad University students protesting fee hike burn PM Modi's effigy
212.article_body: Students of the Allahabad University in Uttar Pradesh burnt effigies of PM Narendra Modi and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan while protesting against fee hike on the occasion of Dussehra on Wednesday. The protesting students have alleged that the fees have been increased by almost 400 times for undergraduate courses.

213.title: US govt paid SpaceX to send Starlink terminals to Ukraine: Report
213.article_body: SpaceX was paid by US government to send Starlink terminals to Ukraine, despite the firm denying any help from the US government, The Washington Post reported. US Agency for International Development (USAID) reportedly edited an earlier press release to remove value of SpaceX's donation in "public-private partnership" that sent terminals to Ukraine. It also removed number of terminals SpaceX sent.

214.title: Election Commission may need a Model Code of Conduct: Kapil Sibal
214.article_body: Senior lawyer Kapil Sibal on Wednesday said the Election Commission of India (ECI) may need a Model Code of Conduct. The Rajya Sabha MP made the remarks after the ECI proposed changing the model code so that political parties provide information on the financial viability of their poll promises. The parties were asked to submit their views on the matter.

215.title: Passengers, staff play garba at Bengaluru airport, videos go viral
215.article_body: Videos of passengers and staff playing garba at the Bengaluru airport last week have gone viral on the internet. Dressed in traditional attires, the staff formed a circle and danced as travellers joined them. Many users said Dasara should also be celebrated at the airport, in accordance with Karnataka's culture.

216.title: Offering jobs on compassionate grounds is a concession, not right: SC
216.article_body: The Supreme Court has observed that offering employment to people on compassionate grounds is a concession aimed at helping crisis-ridden families but it shouldn't be considered a right. The SC made the observation while setting aside a lower court's order, which directed that the respondent woman be appointed for a state government job on compassionate grounds after her mother's death.

217.title: 'What wrong did he do with anyone?' Mother of deceased J&K DG Prisons
217.article_body: The mother of Jammu and Kashmir DG Prisons Hemant Lohia, who was found dead on Monday night, on Wednesday asked, "What wrong did my son do with anyone?" The accused, identified as Yasir Ahmed, first suffocated Lohia to death, then slit his throat with a broken ketchup bottle and later attempted to set the body ablaze.

218.title: 2 MPs, 5 MLAs from Thackeray-led Shiv Sena to join Shinde camp today: MP
218.article_body: Two MPs and five MLAs from the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction will join the camp headed by Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde at the Dussehra rally today (Wednesday), MP Krupal Tumane said. Tumane, who is part of the Shinde group, claimed the two MPs could be from Mumbai and Marathwada. The Shinde group will celebrate Dussehra at Mumbai's MMRDA Ground.

219.title: Number of dog-bite cases fell by more than half in B’luru: BBMP
219.article_body: The number of dog-bite cases have reduced significantly in Bengaluru, from 42,818 cases in 2019 to 17,610 cases in 2021, according to data of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). This year from January to July, 11,291 such incidents were recorded. Most cases this year were recorded from BBMP South Zone, followed by East Zone.

220.title: Trips to US would upset me, a H'wood actor said 'You speak English really well': Deepika
220.article_body: Deepika Padukone, speaking to Business of Fashion magazine, opened up about racial stereotypes in Hollywood. "It'd upset me every time I went to...US," she stated. "I met [this actor]...he said 'Hey...you speak English really well'...When I came back I said, 'What do you mean you speak English really well?' Did he have...notion that we don't speak English?" Deepika added.

221.title: Mother warned to not get into controversy with women in Bigg Boss: MC Stan
221.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant MC Stan revealed his mother has "warned" him to not get into any controversies with women in the show. "She...told me not to raise my hands as that could lead to me getting ousted," he added. "While I'm a happy-go-lucky person, if someone does test my patience, I don't know how will I react," he stated.

222.title: Meta settles lawsuits with 2 firms scraping data from its platforms
222.article_body: Meta has settled lawsuits with Israel-based BrandTotal and US-incorporated Unimania for a "significant sum", Meta said. The two firms were engaged in scraping data from Meta's Facebook and Instagram. They agreed to a permanent injunction, banning them from scraping Facebook and Instagram data or profiting from the data they've already collected. Meta had filed the lawsuits in October 2020.

223.title: 1-minute talk with Rajinikanth about 'Ponniyin...' made my year: Jayam
223.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and revealed that he is overwhelmed after Rajinikanth praised him for his performance in 'Ponniyin Selvan: I'. "That one-minute conversation made my day, my year and added a whole new meaning to my career. Thank you Thalaiva for your kind words and childlike enthusiasm," Jayam further tweeted. The film is directed by Mani Ratnam.

224.title: I don't want to work in Bollywood: Mandana after #MeToo accused Sajid Khan joins Bigg Boss
224.article_body: Talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', actress Mandana Karimi said it makes her "feel sad". She added she doesn't want to work in Bollywood. "I don't want to be involved with an industry where there's no respect for women," she stated. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

225.title: You have 50 mins until your life changes: Nobel Committee to winner at 1:53 am
225.article_body: The Nobel Prize Committee called Stanford University Professor Carolyn Bertozzi at 1:53 am to inform her about her win. "You have 50 minutes to collect yourself and wait until your life changes," the Nobel Committee told her. Carolyn, Morten Meldal and Karl Barry Sharpless jointly won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for the development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry.

226.title: Man beaten with sticks, mother attacked for honking at cows in Guj
226.article_body: A man was assaulted with sticks and his mother was attacked in Gujarat's Ahmedabad for honking at cows sitting in the middle of the road. The owner of the cows got offended, called other men from his community and smashed the victims' car windows. The accused also threatened to kill him if he spoke about the incident, reports said.

227.title: Fire breaks out in storage unit in Mumbai, no casualties reported
227.article_body: A fire broke out in a storage unit near a high-rise building in Mumbai's Andheri area on Wednesday morning. A video showed a huge cloud of smoke rising from the small structure, where bamboos and wood were reportedly stored. An official said three fire trucks and a tanker controlled the flames and there were no injuries or casualties.

228.title: Fine of ₹66,000 collected in drive against unfit vehicles in Navi Mumbai
228.article_body: Navi Mumbai's Vashi Deputy Regional Transport Office (RTO) penalised unfit vehicles during a week-long special campaign and collected a fine of ₹66,000 from 222 vehicles. "We conduct such a drive to ensure...motorists keep their vehicle fit and carry out a regular check to prevent breakdown," an official said. A total of 485 vehicles, including rickshaws, trucks and buses, were inspected.

229.title: Hyd to see light to moderate rain till Sunday, yellow alert issued
229.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has said that Hyderabad city will likely be receiving light to moderate rainfall and thundershowers until October 9. The weather department has also issued a yellow alert for the city for Thursday, October 6. Meanwhile, civic officials cautioned the public to be alert in view of the rain.

230.title: India's sugar export brings record ₹40,000 crore during 2021-22 season
230.article_body: Indian producers exported a record 109.8 Lakh Metric Ton (LMT) of sugar worth ₹40,000 crore in 2021-22. India produced a record 5,000 LMT of sugarcane worth over ₹1.18 lakh crore between October 2021 and September 2022. Out of the total production during the period, about 3,574 LMT was crushed by sugar mills, and 359 LMT of sugar was produced.

231.title: Man harasses woman after engagement breaks off in Delhi; arrested
231.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly stalking and harassing a woman by posting her morphed pictures from a fake Facebook account in her name after their engagement broke off, police said on Wednesday. The accused even posted her mobile number on the profile and portrayed her as a sex worker, a senior police officer said.

232.title: RBI plans to use artificial intelligence for improved regulatory supervision
232.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is planning to use artificial intelligence, advanced analytics and machine learning to analyse its database and improve regulatory supervision on banks and Non Banking Financial Companies. For this purpose, RBI is looking to hire external experts. The bank is already using artificial intelligence and machine learning for supervisory processes.

233.title: Sisodia & Kejriwal are 'twin towers of corruption' in Delhi: BJP
233.article_body: BJP workers on Thursday burnt effigy of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government to protest against corruption in the national capital. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said, "BJP has decided to burn the effigy of corruption on Dussehra to protest against AAP grafts." "This is an effigy of...corruption by Kejriwal and Sisodia. They are the twin towers of corruption," he added.

234.title: Kazakhstan rejects Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian ambassador
234.article_body: Kazakhstan has rejected Russia's demand to expel Ukrainian diplomat, Petro Vrublevskiy, in Astana and instead asked Kyiv to replace him over comments on killing Russians. Vrublevskiy said in an interview "the more Russians we kill now, the fewer...our children will have to kill". Kazakh Foreign Ministry Spokesperson, Aibek Smadiyarov, said Vrublevskiy will leave Kazakhstan once new diplomat comes.

235.title: 2 men get 3 years in prison for beating up minor, his uncle in Thane
235.article_body: A Thane court sentenced two men, Sachin Daulat Bere and Viki Vishnu Bere, to three years of imprisonment for beating up a minor and his uncle over a dispute in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹20,000 each on the accused. Pravin Satpure was playing cricket in the locality when the quarrel took place, additional public prosecutor said.

236.title: Govt entitled to levy GST and excise duty on tobacco: Karnataka High Court
236.article_body: The Karnataka High Court dismissed petitions of tobacco manufacturers, ruling that the government is entitled to impose both Central GST (CGST) and excise duty on tobacco and tobacco-derived products. The court said that the levy of excise duty is a matter of public policy and the CGST itself contemplates levy of excise duty upon tobacco and tobacco products.

237.title: Savita, 1st Indian woman to climb Mt Everest & Makalu in 16 days, dies in U'khand avalanche
237.article_body: Savita Kanswal, first Indian woman to climb Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in 16 days, was among those killed when an avalanche struck a group of trainee mountaineers and instructors from Nehru Institute of Mountaineering in Uttarakhand’s Uttarkashi on Tuesday. The 26-year-old was an instructor at the institute and had scaled Mount Everest and Mount Makalu in May this year.

238.title: 34-year-old Tamil TV actor Lokesh Rajendran dies by suicide
238.article_body: Filmmaker and Tamil television's 34-year-old actor Lokesh Rajendran, best known for his work as a child artist in the serial 'Marmadesam', died by suicide in Chennai on Tuesday. "I came to know there was some misunderstanding between Lokesh and his wife. Legal notice for divorce came from his wife four days ago," his father said. "Lokesh was depressed," he added.

239.title: Middle East, North Africa world's fastest-growing crypto markets: Report
239.article_body: Middle East and North Africa (MENA) are the world's fastest-growing crypto markets, with the volume of crypto received in the region jumping 48% between January-June 2022, Chainalysis said in a report. MENA was followed by Latin America, with a 40% growth rate, and North America, recording 36% growth. Turkey topped the MENA region in terms of value of crypto received.

240.title: Shinde faction supporters used yet-to-be-opened Samruddhi Expressway: Cong MLA
240.article_body: Maharashtra Congress MLA from Jalna, Kailash Gorantyal, claimed that members of Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction used the yet-to-be-opened Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway. Around 100 vehicles of rebel Shiv Sena leader Arjun Khotkar's supporters used the expressway, he said. The expressway will cover the 701-km distance between Mumbai and Nagpur, and is touted to be India's fastest expressway.

241.title: Hrithik said 'You need to stop apologising' as I kept giving retakes: Rohit
241.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said he kept apologising for giving retakes as he was nervous to shoot for a scene. "After we finished the scene, Hrithik sir took me aside," he added. Rohit said, "Hrithik told me, 'You need to stop apologising for not getting something right. We are all trying to make ourselves better over here on set'."

242.title: OYO's valuation falls in private market after markdown by SoftBank: Report
242.article_body: Valuation of IPO-bound OYO fell to around $6.5 billion in the private market after its investor SoftBank cut the hospitality and travel-tech firm's valuation in its private books, PTI reported. Nearly 12.3 lakh shares of OYO were sold in the private market between September 26-30, against 1.6 lakh sold between September 19-23. Softbank had cut OYO's valuation by 20%.

243.title: Where's population imbalance if Hindus & Muslims have same DNA: Owaisi
243.article_body: After RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored and called for a population control policy, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "For Mohan, it's annual day of dog whistles." "If Hindus and Muslims have 'same DNA' then where's 'imbalance'? There's no need for population control," Owaisi said. "Muslims have sharpest decline in fertility rate," he added.

244.title: Delhi Zoo launches Animal Adoption Scheme; to cost ₹6 lakh/yr for adopting lion
244.article_body: Delhi's National Zoological Park has launched Animal Adoption Scheme to let the general public, firms and institutions adopt its animals. According to a circular, the adoption cost ranges from ₹700/year for a zebra finch bird to ₹6 lakh/year for a lion or a tiger. Adopter's name/company's logo will be displayed on a signage in front of the adopted animal's enclosure.

245.title: Mexican President denies spying on critics after Pegasus allegations
245.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has denied that his administration spied on journalists or opponents after reports emerged that phones of two journalists and a human rights activist were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021. On Tuesday, Mexico's Defence Ministry said it does not carry out intelligence activities, much less espionage, against human rights defenders.

246.title: Will induct 2,000 members on Dussehra to fight 'demonic mentality': AAP
246.article_body: AAP's Gujarat President Gopal Italia on Wednesday said that it would induct nearly 2,000 members on the day of Dussehra to "combat demonic mentality". Among those inducted on Wednesday was Hardik Barot, who was the Vice President of the Congress' Gandhidham unit. Barot joined AAP in the presence of its state election in-charge, Gulab Singh Yadav.

247.title: He has not fitted into any role: Ajay Jadeja on Pant's form in T20Is
247.article_body: Talking about wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's form in T20Is, former cricketer Ajay Jadeja said the 25-year-old has not "fitted into any role" in the format. "The Indian team has moved on to role-playing acts...that's where Pant has lost out...With that role-play that DK is doing, it works," stated Jadeja. Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last 15 T20I innings.

248.title: PM Modi participates in Dussehra Rath Yatra in Kullu, thousands gather; video surfaces
248.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in Dussehra Rath Yatra during International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu in Himachal Pradesh on Wednesday. Photos from the event showed thousands of people attending the International Dussehra celebrations in Kullu. Notably, this is the first time that the Prime Minister of the country is participating in the Kullu Dussehra celebrations.

249.title: SoftBank CEO didn't pitch Arm investment to Samsung in Seoul: Report
249.article_body: SoftBank Group Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son, who is on a visit to Seoul, on Tuesday discussed long-term cooperation between chip designer Arm and Samsung Electronics. However, he didn't propose Samsung to invest in its subsidiary, Arm, according to a local media report. Son had earlier said that he'd like to talk with Samsung about a "strategic alliance with Arm".

250.title: AIIMS Bilaspur will be known as 'Green AIIMS', it's eco-friendly: PM
250.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, PM Narendra Modi said the hospital is eco-friendly and will be known as "Green AIIMS". The hospital will increase access to affordable healthcare in the state, PM Modi added. He said Himachal has played a crucial role in "rashtra raksha" and now with AIIMS Bilaspur, it'll play a pivotal role in "jeevan raksha".

251.title: SEBI imposes 5-year market ban on Gautam Thapar in CG Power case
251.article_body: CG Power and Industrial Solutions' former Chairman Gautam Thapar and three other entities were imposed a five-year ban and fine by the Securities and Exchange Board of India for diversion of funds and misrepresentation of the company's financial statements earlier. SEBI also penalised a total of 11 entities, including KN Neelkant, Atul Gulatee, Aditya Birla Finance Limited and IndusInd Bank.

252.title: H'yana CM reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
252.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Wednesday reached Medanta Hospital in Gurugram to check on the health of former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted there. "Met with [his] family, his son Akhilesh Yadav. Wishing for his quick recovery. Doctors say there is an improvement, but full recovery will take time," Khattar said.

253.title: Adani Enterprises announces 2 new subsidiaries
253.article_body: Adani Enterprises has announced the creation of a wholly-owned subsidiary Adani Disruptive Ventures (ADVL) along with another subsidiary Alwar Alluvial Resources (AARL), a stock exchanges filing said. Jeet Adani, Vice President of group finance for the Adani Group is a part of the core team of ADVL. Alwar Alluvial Resources will be engaged in the manufacturing and processing of minerals.

254.title: HDFC Bank reports 23.5% jump in loans in Q2, highest in over 3 yrs
254.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 23.5% year-on-year surge in loan advancements to ₹14.8 lakh crore in the September quarter. This is its highest loan growth in more than three years or 14 quarters. Advances grew 25.8% from last year, including inter-bank participation certificates and rediscounted bills. Deposits for the September quarter increased 19% to ₹16.73 lakh crore.

255.title: Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag Kansara has passed away: Sunil Pal
255.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal took to social media to share a video wherein he revealed that comedian Parag Kansara has passed away. "Our Laughter Challenge companion Parag is no more...I've no idea what's happening to the comedy world...Just few days ago...we had lost Raju Srivastava." Parag was one of the six contestants in first season of The Great Indian Laughter Challenge.

256.title: Who are the only 5 people to win the Nobel Prize twice?
256.article_body: American chemist Karl Barry Sharpless, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry on Wednesday, and in 2001, is the fifth individual to be awarded two Nobel Prizes. Besides him, Nobel Prize laureates John Bardeen, Marie Skłodowska-Curie, Linus Pauling and Frederick Sanger have won two Nobel Prizes each. Curie became the first person to receive two Nobel Prizes in 1911.

257.title: India's stand on Ukraine-Russia war shows we're being heard: Bhagwat
257.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that India's stand during the Ukraine-Russia conflict showed the country was being heard. "We're becoming more and more self-reliant on the national security front as well," he said. "Bharat's importance and stature have increased in the community of nations. In the sphere of security, we are becoming more and more self-sufficient," he added.

258.title: Hyderabad Police bust red sanders smuggling gang, 500 kg wood seized
258.article_body: The Hyderabad Commissioner's Task Force along with Forest Department officials busted an interstate red sanders smuggling gang and seized 500 kg wood worth ₹75 lakh from them, police said. Four persons were arrested and one accused is currently absconding. The main accused, Shaik Abdullah, reportedly incurred losses in real estate and decided to smuggle red sanders, police stated.

259.title: Indian Oil, BPCL plan oil deals before sanctions on Russian crude: Report
259.article_body: State-owned refiners are looking to lock-in more of their crude supplies in term deals amid concerns over tighter Western sanctions, including from the EU on Russian crude, Reuters reported. Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum are seeking term deals with countries, including the US. "We're preparing for a backup...world is uncertain because of Russia-Ukraine conflict," an official said.

260.title: 46% CEOs globally planning job cuts, 39% freeze hiring: KPMG report
260.article_body: With signs that the Great Resignation could be cooling down, 39% of CEOs have implemented a hiring freeze and 46% are considering downsizing their workforce over the next six months, according to the eighth edition of KPMG 2022 CEO Outlook. The report also mentioned that three-year view is more optimistic with only 9% CEOs are expecting a further reduced headcount.

261.title: India's Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for 2 days, shows ICC's data
261.article_body: As per ICC's data, India batter Suryakumar Yadav became world number one T20I batter for two days. He achieved top rank with 854 rating points after overtaking Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan on October 2 and remained on top position on October 3 as well. However, he slipped to second position after scoring 8(6) against South Africa in third T20I on Tuesday.

262.title: Uber asks employees to work from office twice a week from Nov 1
262.article_body: Uber has asked employees to work from the office twice a week. It announced Tuesdays and Thursdays as "anchor days", wherein all non-remote employees must work from the office globally, starting November 1. Earlier, Uber allowed staff to work from anywhere as much as half the time, but now they can work remotely for up to four weeks per year.

263.title: WI going to be struggling for a long time: Ex-WI player Winston Benjamin
263.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Winston Benjamin has criticised their current management, stating that they don't even have the "quality" to be picking a side that would compete at the international level. "We are going to be struggling for a long time," he added. Earlier in August, WI lost two T20I series at home, first against India and then against New Zealand.

264.title: Elections to be held in J&K after voters’ list compilation: Shah
264.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said elections will be held in J&K with "full transparency" as soon as work of compiling the voters’ list is completed. Furthermore, he said manner in which delimitation has been done in the region, representatives of the people’s choice will be elected. The Union Home Minister was addressing a public rally in Baramulla.

265.title: Credit Suisse's Deputy Head of wealth management in Asia resigns
265.article_body: The Deputy Head of Credit Suisse's Asia-Pacific wealth management business Young Jin Yee has resigned. This development comes at a time when the shares of Switzerland's second-biggest bank touched a new record low after declining 12% on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

266.title: Chiranjeevi says he wasn't satisfied with 'Lucifer', Mohanlal fans react
266.article_body: At GodFather's pre-release event, Chiranjeevi said he "wasn't completely satisfied with 'Lucifer'". The statement received reactions from Mohanlal fans. A fan tweeted, "'Lucifer' movie is classic, nobody can come near it," while another fan called the statement "really unprofessional and arrogant". Meanwhile, Chiranjeevi fans are calling 'GodFather' his "great comeback" after Acharya's failure.

267.title: Congress, NCP to support Uddhav's candidate in Andheri East bypoll
267.article_body: Congress and NCP extended support to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction's candidate in the bypoll for Andheri East Assembly seat. Congress' Nana Patole said his party firmly stands with Shiv Sena and will not field any candidate. The bypoll was necessitated after Shiv Sena MLA Ramesh Latke's death. Shiv Sena has decided to field Latke's wife Rutuja.

268.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd for Durga idol immersion on Oct 6
268.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for immersion of Durga idols in Hussain Sagar lake on Thursday, October 6. Traffic will be diverted at NTR Marg and People's Plaza on Necklace Road from 4 pm till the immersion concludes. Traffic coming from Ambedkar statue will not be allowed towards NTR Marg and will be diverted towards Iqbal Minar.

269.title: MCD signs deal with Lajpat Nagar traders’ body over sanitation of market roads
269.article_body: MCD has signed an agreement with the Traders Association Lajpat Nagar, where the traders' body will take care of sanitation and sweeping services of six-kilometre roads in and around the marketplace. Cleaning of roads will be done using a mechanised machine, which will reduce the dust factor from the roads, Traders Association Lajpat Nagar (TALN) General Secretary Ashwani Marwah said.

270.title: Russian TV journalist who protested invasion says she escaped house arrest
270.article_body: Russian TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who staged an on-air protest against the Russian invasion of Ukraine, confirmed she had escaped house arrest. Ovsyannikova was put under a two-month house arrest in August over a protest in which she called Russian President Vladimir Putin a murderer. "I refuse to comply with...restraint imposed on me...and release myself from it," she said.

271.title: Violence against Muslims is treated as justice in PM's new India: Owaisi
271.article_body: Criticising the Centre over the violence in Gujarat's Kheda during Navratri celebrations, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that "every day there is more evidence of mass radicalisation". "Floggings and mob violence by police have become common. Targeted violence against Muslims is treated as 'justice'. This is the reality of Modi's Vishwaguru/New India/5G/$5 Trillion Ton economy," Owaisi said.

272.title: Delhi woman cheats 25 people of over ₹1 cr in kitty scheme; arrested
272.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a 52-year-old woman, a resident of Delhi's Dwarka, for allegedly cheating her neighbours of over ₹1 crore by running a kitty. She cheated over 25 people by inducing them to invest money and promising to return matured amount within 15 months. She shifted to an unknown place after the maturity period passed.

273.title: I make the money, my mother Soni Razdan handles it: Alia Bhatt
273.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that her relationship with money is that she makes it and her mother Soni Razdan handles it. "I'm not sure how much money I have in the bank...I do sit with my team and have an idea...I know my mother is handling it very well," she added. Alia recently featured in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra'.

274.title: If Shami is to replace Bumrah, then he should've played Asia Cup: Aakash
274.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has criticised the Indian management over Mohammad Shami's omission from recent tours and the 2022 Asia Cup. "Jasprit Bumrah missed the tour to West Indies and Asia Cup...and if Shami [is] indeed the best option to replace Bumrah...then he should have been a part of the Asia Cup at the very least," wrote Aakash on Twitter.

275.title: No call for ransom yet: Relative of Indian-origin family abducted in US
275.article_body: There has been no call for ransom till now, said a relative of the Indian-origin family that was abducted in US' California on Monday. "[The family's] car was found burnt 20-25 kilometres away from their office. Their mobile phones have been found," the relative, who lives in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, said. US authorities have reportedly released a potential suspect's photo.

276.title: Pune civic body starts drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters
276.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has started a drive to confiscate properties of tax defaulters. "In the past few days, we've confiscated properties of 21 citizens who failed to pay their tax. Of these 21, 12 defaulters came forward and have so far paid ₹93 lakh in arrears," an official said. PCMC has decided to seize over 1,300 properties in total.

277.title: Ukraine forces approach borders of Luhansk Oblast that Russia annexed: UK
277.article_body: UK has said Ukrainian soldiers have advanced up to 20 km beyond the Oskil river in northeastern Kharkiv towards Luhansk Oblast. "Russian leaders will...be concerned that leading Ukrainian units are approaching the borders of Luhansk Oblast, which Russia claimed to have annexed," UK Defence Ministry said. Russia formally annexed four regions of Ukraine on Wednesday.

278.title: White.Inc raises $1 mn in round led by Dholakia Ventures, others
278.article_body: White.Inc﻿ has raised $1 million in funding led by Dholakia Ventures, which also saw the participation of Inflection Point Ventures and FirstPort. Other participants in the round included angel investors Suhail Sameer and Shashvat Nakrani from BharatPe, Gunavanth Vaid from 4G Capital Ventures and Aniket Gore from Ceramet Group. White.Inc was founded by Siddharth Gadodia and Young Yun in 2021.

279.title: Previous govts laid stones, forgot completing projects after polls: PM in Himachal
279.article_body: After inaugurating AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh, PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally, said development in Himachal Pradesh is possible as people have voted BJP to power. "Previous governments used to lay stones and forget about completing projects after polls, but our government lays stones and inaugurates projects," PM Modi added.

280.title: No talks with Pakistan; Modi govt won't tolerate terrorism: Shah
280.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah ruled out holding any dialogue with Pakistan. He said, "Some people say we should talk to Pakistan. Why should we talk to Pakistan? We will not talk. We will talk to the people of...Kashmir." He added that PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government does not tolerate terrorism.

281.title: 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar rescued: MEA
281.article_body: India on Wednesday said that it has rescued around 45 Indians trapped in fake job rackets in Myanmar. The information was shared by the spokesperson of the Ministry of External Affairs, Arindam Bagchi. More Indians have been rescued and are in the custody of Myanmar authorities, Bagchi said, adding that legal formalities for their repatriation have begun.

282.title: Civilian killed in accidental firing, policeman arrested: J&K Police
282.article_body: A 25-year-old civilian, Asif Ahmad, was killed after a policeman's service rifle went off at a checkpoint in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Wednesday, said police. SHO Zafar Ahmad said it was a misfire. The victim was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed. The policeman was arrested and his weapon was seized, said police.

283.title: Protesting teachers climb atop water tank in Punjab, threaten self-immolation
283.article_body: Demanding jobs as physical training instructors (PTI) in government schools for a year now, two teachers climbed a water tank in Mohali protesting against the Punjab government and threatened self-immolation. AAP government is giving false assurance to us, said one of the protesting teachers. Last year, five teachers staged a similar protest by climbing atop a water tank in Mohali.

284.title: Former Haryana MLA Anil Dhantori quits Congress
284.article_body: Anil Dhantori, a former MLA from Shahbad assembly segment of Haryana's Kurukshetra district, left Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter, Dhantori said that he is resigning from the party's primary membership and from the post of National Media Panelist (Spokesperson) of Congress. Sharing the letter on Twitter, Dhantori wrote, "Farewell Congress." He represented Shahbad from 2009 to 2014.

285.title: Congress loses chair of Parliamentary panels on IT, Home
285.article_body: Congress leaders have been removed as heads of parliamentary standing committees on Home Affairs and Information Technology. Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor, who headed the IT committee, has been replaced by Prataprao Jadhav, a Shiv Sena MP from the Eknath Shinde faction. Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi has been replaced by BJP MP Brij Lal as Home Affairs committee chairman.

286.title: Michael Bevan picks 3 teams as favourites to win 2022 T20 World Cup
286.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Michael Bevan has picked India, England and Australia as his favourites to win the 2022 T20 World Cup. Bevan, however, added, "Given the home ground advantage (for Australia), it should help [them] a little bit." Notably, India recently defeated Australia 2-1 in their three-match T20I series. Australia had won the 2021 T20 WC after defeating New Zealand.

287.title: Co-founder & strategy head of bankrupt crypto firm Celsius steps down
287.article_body: Bankrupt cryptocurrency lending firm Celsius' Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer, S Daniel Leon has stepped down, the company said on Tuesday. The announcement comes a week after the company's CEO Alex Mashinsky resigned from his position. In July, Celsius had filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, a month after pausing withdrawals, citing extreme market conditions.

288.title: Bertozzi, Meldal, Sharpless win Chemistry Nobel for click chemistry, get ₹7.45-cr prize
288.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Chemistry has been awarded to Carolyn R Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K Barry Sharpless. They have been awarded the prize for the "development of click chemistry and bioorthogonal chemistry". For their Nobel win, they will get 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.45 crore) prize money.

289.title: Woman traces snatcher using smartwatch in Gurugram, gets phone back after hitting him
289.article_body: A woman in Gurugram, using her smartwatch, tracked a man for about three hours and took back her mobile that he had snatched from her in a market. She told the police that he snatched her phone while she was performing a UPI transaction. When she spotted him, she hit him on his head and later approached the police.

290.title: IT Minister drops made-in-India smartphone to test its strength
290.article_body: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who attended the recently-concluded digital technology forum India Mobile Congress (IMC), intentionally dropped a made-in-India smartphone to test its strength. In a video of the event's highlights shared by the minister, he was seen dropping the phone to the ground. IMC, the largest digital technology forum in Asia, was held from October 1-4 in Delhi.

291.title: Unknown caller issues life threats to Mukesh, Nita Ambani; Mumbai Police probes
291.article_body: An unknown person called on the landline number of Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai on Wednesday and issued life threats to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani. The caller also issued threats to Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani and Anant Ambani and threatened to blow up the hospital. "Investigation in this matter is being done," Mumbai Police said.

292.title: 3 arrested after viral video shows them beating a dog in B'luru
292.article_body: Three men were arrested in Bengaluru after a purported video of them beating a dog went viral on social media. The three men thrashed the dog with wooden canes for barking at them the previous day, reports said. The dog's owner, who filmed the incident, was pushed by the accused when he tried to intervene.

293.title: Default electricity subsidy extended in Delhi, to continue till Oct 31
293.article_body: Delhi government has extended the default electricity subsidy by one more month, till October 31. Now, consumers who failed to opt-in for the subsidy till September 30, will get free electricity up to 200 units and 50% subsidy on the consumption of below 400 units in October also. From November, only those who opt for it will get the subsidy.

294.title: If Raavan's from Lanka, he shouldn't look like Mughals: Dipika on 'Adipurush'
294.article_body: Actress Dipika Chikhlia, who played Sita in the show 'Ramayan', opened up about Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in 'Adipurush'. "A film's characters must appeal to the audience. If the character is from Sri Lanka, they should not look like Mughals," she stated. 'Adipurush' was trolled on Twitter over its VFX and Saif's look after the teaser was released.

295.title: PM's governance model brings employment, Gupkar model offers guns: Shah in J&K
295.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing a public rally in J&K's Baramulla on Wednesday, said that PM Narendra Modi's model of governance brings development and employment. "The Gupkar model offers stones and guns in hands of the youth," Shah added. "There is a lot of difference between [PM] Modi's model and Gupkar model," Shah stated.

296.title: Over 200 fall sick In Gurugram society, water contamination suspected
296.article_body: Over 200 residents of a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 72 have fallen sick in the past two days with vomiting and diarrhoea, prompting the health department to look into complaints of suspected water contamination. The concerned officials said that they have collected water samples for examination and a report will be out soon.

297.title: Emerson to sell part of assets to Blackstone for up to $10 bn: Report
297.article_body: Emerson Electric is in talks with US buyout firm Blackstone to sell a part of its commercial and residential solution business assets, Bloomberg reported. The deal's value could be between $5 billion-$10 billion and would depend on the assets Emerson decides to sell. This comes after Emerson announced an $11-billion merger of its software units with Aspen Technology last year.

298.title: 30-year-old motorcyclist killed by 3 men in road rage in Ahmedabad
298.article_body: Three men allegedly killed a 30-year-old motorcyclist in a case of road rage in Ahmedabad. The incident took place on Monday after the three men going on a motorcycle asked the other motorcyclist to stop for nearly hitting their bike. Inspector YJ Rathod of Meghaninagar police said all three men are aged between 20 and 25 years.

299.title: CCTV footage shows dog carrying human skull in Navi Mumbai; probe on
299.article_body: A human skull was found near a company premises in Mahape, Navi Mumbai, on Tuesday. CCTV footage in the premises showed a dog carrying the skull three days ago. Rabale MIDC Police said the skull was completely burnt. They've launched an investigation to ascertain whether a body has been dumped anywhere or the dog brought the skull from a crematorium.

300.title: No charge for using RuPay credit card for UPI transactions up to ₹2,000: NPCI
300.article_body: National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Tuesday said there'll be no charges on use of RuPay credit cards on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) for transactions worth up to ₹2,000. As per an NPCI circular, UPI apps would ensure complete transparency on transactions using a credit card. The step has been taken to encourage wider acceptance of RuPay cards.

301.title: When you leave Mannat, SRK opens the car door for you: Riteish Deshmukh
301.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh has said that the most special thing about a get-together in Shah Rukh Khan's residence Mannat is its host. "Whenever you are leaving, SRK would come with you to your car and open the door of the car for you," he added. Riteish further revealed that dinner in such get-togethers is served at 3 AM.

302.title: Andhra doctor requests India to save his pet jaguar and panther from Ukraine
302.article_body: An orthopaedic doctor from Andhra Pradesh, who was based in Ukraine when the war with Russia broke out, has appealed to Indian government to help rescue his pet jaguar and panther. Dr Gidikumar Patil was forced to leave them behind with a local farmer when he left Ukraine for Poland. Dr Patil said he gets depressed thinking about the cats.

303.title: Wanted to become journalist, was huge Barkha Dutt fan: Hina Khan
303.article_body: Hina Khan said she "wanted to become a journalist" and was a huge Barkha Dutt fan, but "destiny had some other plans". She revealed that her friends "kind of forced" her to audition for 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai'. "I got selected in the first round, then they asked me to come to Bombay... and I started shooting," she said.

304.title: Russian Prez Putin signs bills to formally annex 4 regions of Ukraine
304.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday completed the formal annexation of more than 15% of Ukraine. Putin has signed bills admitting the Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia regions into Russia. Earlier, the annexation legislation was unanimously passed by both houses of the Russian Parliament. The formalities followed after referendums were held in the four regions amidst the war.

305.title: Makers wanted Sridevi to do an item song: 'English Vinglish' director
305.article_body: 'English Vinglish' director Gauri Shinde shared that the producers she initially approached for the 2012 film wanted Sridevi to do an item song. "I said I would rather put the film aside and not make it. Then Balki (R Balki, filmmaker-husband) decided to produce it ourselves," she said, adding that 'English Vinglish' was "the toughest thing" to be made.

306.title: Religion-based population imbalance can't be ignored: RSS chief
306.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that the religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored, adding that India needs a comprehensive population control policy which applies to all "equally" for the next 50 years. "Alongside the differences in birth rate, conversions by force, lure or greed and infiltration are also big reasons," he said.

307.title: Pet cat in US breaks world record for being the tallest living domestic cat, pics surface
307.article_body: A pet cat named Fenrir Antares Powers, which lives in US' Michigan, has been confirmed by the Guinness World Records as the world's tallest living domestic cat. Fenrir measures 47.83 cm (18.83 in). Fenrir is the brother of Arcturus Aldebaran Powers, who formerly held the record before passing away. Arcturus measured in at 48.40 cm (19.05 in).

308.title: Can't doubt experts' wisdom: Delhi HC rejects PIL against NEET answer key
308.article_body: Delhi High Court has rejected a plea of a 2022 NEET-UG candidate who challenged the final answer key of the exam and claimed that some answers provided in it were incorrect. However, NTA, which checked the NEET papers, said the answer key was created after consultation with medical experts. The court said, "[Law]...doesn't permit...to doubt the wisdom of the experts."

309.title: IMD predicts heavy rain in Bengaluru today; issues yellow alert
309.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in Bengaluru on Wednesday and issued a yellow alert for several districts of Karnataka. The meteorological department also said that other districts near Bengaluru like Kolar, Chikkaballapur and Bengaluru Rural are also likely to get light showers. A yellow alert has also been issued for Chitradurga and Davanagere districts.

310.title: Waqar Younis missed 1992 WC in Aus, but Pak still won: Ajay Jadeja on Bumrah
310.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said India shouldn't have a problem without Jasprit Bumrah in the upcoming T20 World Cup as they've done well in many matches without the pacer this year. Jadeja also cited Pakistan's 1992 WC win, stating that Pakistan won the title that year without Waqar Younis, who had also been ruled out due to an injury.

311.title: Woman kills husband with lover's help in UP, stages it as suicide
311.article_body: A 32-year-old woman having an affair allegedly strangled her husband to death with her lover's help in UP's Raebareli. The accused, Shubha and Sumair, are said to have hung the victim's body from the ceiling to make it look like suicide. They even planted a suicide note, the handwriting on which matched with that of Sumair's, according to police.

312.title: US military aid to Ukraine increases risk of clash with West: Russian envoy
312.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, said that Washington's decision to send more military aid to Ukraine poses "an immediate threat" to Moscow's strategic interests. "The supply of military products by...US and its allies not only entails protracted bloodshed and new casualties but also increases the danger of a direct military clash between Russia and Western countries," he added.

313.title: Gurugram man's phone stolen after suspects see him put ATM card inside phone cover
313.article_body: A man's mobile phone was allegedly stolen by two men who saw him put his ATM card inside the phone cover while he was coming out of an ATM in Gurugram's MG Road. The suspects caught the man while he was walking towards DLF Phase-II and snatched his phone. Later, they withdrew ₹50,000 and made UPI transactions using the card.

314.title: Solomon Islands PM to visit Australia amid tensions over pact with China
314.article_body: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare will visit Australia on Thursday. The visit comes six months after the Pacific island nation signed a security pact with China under which Beijing was permitted to send forces in order to "maintain social order". Sogavare and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese last met in Fiji at the Pacific Islands Forum in July.

315.title: People panic as ballistic missile fired by South Korea crashes
315.article_body: A ballistic missile, which was fired by South Korea in response to North Korea's launch of a ballistic missile over Japan, crashed. The crash caused panic among nearby residents who thought they were under attack from North Korea. The South Korean military said the warhead of the missile did not explode.

316.title: I told Babar if he wants me to play, I'll play, I'm available: Shoaib Malik
316.article_body: Veteran Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who hasn't been picked in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup, has said he's available for selection and will play if captain Babar Azam wants him to play. "I have always been available for Pakistan and I still am," said Shoaib in an interview. Shoaib last played for Pakistan in November 2021.

317.title: Icahn amassed Twitter stake worth $500 mn in the last few months: WSJ
317.article_body: Activist investor Carl Icahn acquired a Twitter stake worth more than $500 million in the past few months and benefited from Elon Musk deciding to go ahead with his Twitter deal on Tuesday, the Wall Street Journal reported. The estimated profit for Icahn Enterprises could exceed $250 million as Twitter shares jumped 22% to $52 on Tuesday.

318.title: Russia discusses continuing space station participation beyond 2024
318.article_body: Russia is internally discussing continuing its participation in the ISS beyond 2024. Head of human space programs at Roscosmos Sergei Krikalev admitted that a new Russian station may not be ready by 2025. "We know that it's not going to happen very [quickly], so probably we will keep flying [on the ISS] until we have any new infrastructure," he added.

319.title: Russia praises Musk's proposal for Ukraine war, says it's 'very positive'
319.article_body: Russia's spokesman Dmitry Peskov welcomed Elon Musk's proposal for the Ukraine war, saying, "It's very positive that somebody like...Musk is looking for a peaceful way". "Musk is still searching for ways to achieve peace. And achieving peace without fulfilling Russia's conditions is...impossible," he added. Ukraine's outgoing ambassador to Germany, Andrij Melnyk had slammed Musk over the proposal.

320.title: Centre plans 18 ropeway projects, new ropeways likely in Ujjain, Srinagar
320.article_body: The Centre is planning to start work on 18 ropeway projects across India totalling about 90 km in the next few months. A ropeway will likely be made to reach Srinagar's Shankaracharya temple, another one to Leh Palace and one up to Gwalior Fort. Centre has also invited tenders for construction of a two-kilometre-long ropeway to Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain.

321.title: Telangana CM KCR launches national party, names it Bharat Rashtra Samithi
321.article_body: Telangana CM and Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) chief K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday launched his national party and named it Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) at Telangana Bhavan. KCR also renamed Telangana Rashtra Samithi as Bharat Rashtra Samithi. The decision to rename TRS as BRS was taken in the general body meeting earlier on Wednesday morning.

322.title: Money or VFX won't make a film Ramayan: Mukesh Khanna on 'Adipurush'
322.article_body: Commenting on Adipurush's teaser, Mukesh Khanna said only "VFX or investing ₹100- ₹1,000 crore" cannot make a film Ramayan. "Pardon me for saying it straight, but the film will not work," he said. Mukesh added, "I warn rich people - don't use your money to change our rituals, religion or epics. If you wish to, try it with other religions."

323.title: After iPhones, Apple to produce some AirPods, Beats headphone in India: Report
323.article_body: Apple is reportedly asking its suppliers to move some AirPods and Beats headphone production to India for the first time. As per a report, Luxshare Precision Industry, which already produces AirPods in Vietnam and China, plans to help Apple make AirPods in India. Notably, Apple recently announced its plans to manufacture the latest iPhone 14 in India.

324.title: A quality Tamil historical film after years: Shankar on 'Ponniyin Selvan'
324.article_body: Director Shankar said 'Ponniyin Selvan' is a "quality Tamil historical film", which has "yet again proven" Mani Ratnam's "mastery in filmmaking". He called AR Rahman's music "riveting" and praised Ravi Varman's "picturesque" cinematography. "Full three hours intrigue you for the sequel. Hail to the vast army that made this epic," he tweeted.

325.title: UP power official suspended after sharing posts against PM, Yogi
325.article_body: A Sub-Divisional Officer (SDO) in the electricity department of UP's Mau has been suspended after he shared posts against PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath on social media. His posts targeted PM Modi on issues like demonetisation, a probe found. According to an official, Radha Krishna Rao also had multiple complaints filed against him for misbehaving with consumers.

326.title: Indian Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh; 1 pilot dies, another injured
326.article_body: A Cheetah helicopter of the Indian Army crashed in Arunachal Pradesh on Wednesday morning, killing a pilot and injuring another, said the Army. The helicopter crashed in a forward area near Tawang during a routine sortie, the Army added. Both pilots were evacuated to the nearest military hospital but Lieutenant Colonel Saurabh Yadav, who was critically injured, died during treatment.

327.title: IPL auction wasn't on mind, was just trying to score after 2 ducks: Rossouw
327.article_body: Talking about his maiden T20I hundred in their match against India on Tuesday, South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw said the IPL auction was not on his mind as he was just trying to score runs after consecutive ducks in his last two innings. Notably, Rossouw last played in the IPL in 2015. The 32-year-old slammed 100*(48) in the match.

328.title: Amit Shah chairs security review meeting with officials in J&K
328.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday chaired a security review meeting with senior officials in J&K's Srinagar. The Home Minister is currently on a visit to the Union Territory. J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and other senior officials including J&K DGP Dilbag Singh and top officials of the Army were present at the meeting.

329.title: Dargah razed in Porbandar, Section 144 imposed in various parts
329.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC was imposed in various parts of Gujarat's Porbandar after the district administration demolished Muradsha Pir Dargah during a drive against encroachment. The police fired tear gas to prevent a mob marching towards the site. A Gujarat Waqf Board official said they received a notice on September 29 but were not given sufficient time to respond.

330.title: New Zealand's Reserve Bank hikes rates by 50 bps to a 7-year high
330.article_body: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ) on Wednesday hiked interest rates by 50 basis points to a seven-year high as the country grapples with inflation. "Core consumer price inflation is too high and labour resources are scarce," RBNZ Governor Adrian Orr said. This is the fifth such large-sized move and the eighth rate hike in 12 months.

331.title: India to depart for T20 World Cup 2022 without their 15th player
331.article_body: India will be leaving for T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia in less than 24 hours with around 18 players in their contingent, but without the official 15th player of the squad. Talking about Jasprit Bumrah's potential replacement, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We've got to get someone in who's got experience...I don't know who that guy is yet."

332.title: Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express travel time revised from today
332.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) has further reduced the travelling time of the newly-introduced Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express train with effect from Wednesday. According to Western Railway's release, the Vande Bharat Express will take five minutes less to cover the distance from Mumbai Central to Gujarat's Gandhinagar and will also arrive 20 minutes early at Mumbai Central from Gandhinagar.

333.title: OPEC+ may cut oil output in Wednesday's meet amid clashes with US
333.article_body: OPEC+ is looking to cut oil output during Wednesday's meeting even as the US is pushing the nations to not proceed with the cut amid rising gasoline prices. OPEC+, which includes Saudi Arabia and Russia, is reportedly planning on cuts in excess of 1 million barrels per day. On Tuesday, Brent crude rose by 3% above $91/barrel.

334.title: Avenue Supermarts' Q2 standalone revenue jumps 35.8% to ₹10,385 cr
334.article_body: Avenue Supermarts, the operator of DMart retail stores, posted a 35.8% year-on-year surge in revenue from operations to ₹10,384.7 crore for the quarter ended September. The standalone revenue in Q2 FY23 nearly doubled as against the pre-COVID-19 period of Q2 FY20. Its shares closed at ₹4,476.50 apiece on the BSE on Tuesday, up 1.15% from the previous day's close.

335.title: Women are taken for granted even today: Madhuri Dixit
335.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said that women are taken for granted even today, but there's "a lot of improvement" in the patriarchal society. Talking about the female representation in films, Madhuri said actresses are no more "slotted into stereotypes" and are "not just props". Crediting writers for the change, Madhuri said, "It's a great time to be in the industry."

336.title: US calls for UN meeting on North Korea missile launch, China & Russia oppose
336.article_body: The US along with Britain, France, Albania, Norway and Ireland urged the UN Security Council (UNSC) to meet after North Korea fired a ballistic missile over Japan. However, China and Russia told council counterparts that they oppose a public meeting, diplomats said. The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called the missile launch a "reckless act", UN spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric said.

337.title: RSS invites woman chief guest at its event for the 1st time in history
337.article_body: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh invited a woman for the first time in its history in the form of mountaineer Santosh Yadav as the chief guest at the annual RSS Vijayadashami festival. The festival was inaugurated by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. Yadav is the first woman in the world to scale the Mount Everest twice.

338.title: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti claims she is under house arrest, police deny
338.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said while Union Home Minister Amit Shah is on a visit to J&K, she has been placed under house arrest to prevent her from visiting north Kashmir's Pattan. However, Srinagar Police said no restriction was put and "she's free to travel". Mufti said Baramulla SP informed her that she won't be allowed to travel to Pattan.

339.title: PM Modi inaugurates AIIMS Bilaspur constructed at cost of ₹1,470 crore
339.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated AIIMS Bilaspur in Himachal Pradesh constructed at a cost of more than ₹1,470 crore. Himachal CM Jairam Thakur, Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP president JP Nadda were also present during the inauguration. AIIMS Bilaspur has 18 speciality and 17 super speciality departments, and 750 beds with 64 ICU beds, PM's office said.

340.title: Amazon freezes hiring for corporate roles in its global retail business: Report
340.article_body: Amazon is freezing hiring for all corporate roles in its global retail segment, as per a report. Over 10,000 openings were posted in that division, accounting for the bulk of Amazon's sales. Amazon instructed recruiters to close all open job postings for those roles in the coming days. "We expect to keep adjusting our hiring strategies," said an Amazon spokesperson.

341.title: Deepika Padukone attends Louis Vuitton show in Paris, pics surface
341.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Tuesday attended Louis Vuitton's show at the Paris Fashion Week. In the photos shared by her fans on social media platforms, Deepika was seen seated in the front row of the show with Hollywood stars such as Ana De Armas, Alicia Vikander and others. The show was organised at the Louvre.

342.title: Fire breaks out at hospital in Agra; building owner, son and daughter die
342.article_body: At least three persons were killed after a fire broke out at a building with a private hospital in the Shahganj area in Uttar Pradesh's Agra on Wednesday morning, police said. The building owner, his son and daughter died in the fire, police added. Notably, two other persons were injured and are out of danger, police further said.

343.title: Traffic restrictions, diversions in Noida, Ghaziabad today for Dussehra
343.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police have announced vehicular restrictions and diversions in parts of the city today amid Dussehra events in Noida's Sector 21A stadium and Sector 62. The police have asked commuters to take alternate routes and six cranes have been arranged to tackle vehicle breakdowns. Meanwhile, Ghaziabad Traffic Police have announced traffic diversions on Delhi-Meerut road and GT road.

344.title: Over 2 lakh mobilised into Russian Army in 2 weeks: Defence Min
344.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said over 2,00,000 people have been conscripted into the country's army since President Vladimir Putin announced a mobilisation drive on September 21. The Kremlin has called the mobilisation "partial" and said it aims to recruit 3,00,000 men to fight in Ukraine. Tens of thousands of men have fled Russia to avoid the military call-up.

345.title: Woman who hugged elderly men to steal valuables in Mumbai arrested
345.article_body: A woman who used to hug elderly men to steal valuables such as jewellery and phones from them in Mumbai has been arrested, said police. The accused, Geeta Patel, usually targeted old men out on walks alone or those travelling in auto-rickshaws, said police. She used to ask for a lift and then seduce them to steal valuables, added police.

346.title: We need to empower women with freedom of making decisions: RSS chief
346.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Wednesday said that a society can't progress without women. "We need to treat women with equality and empower them with freedom of making their own decisions," Bhagwat said at a Dussehra event in Maharashtra's Nagpur. "It is imperative to give women independence to work and equal rights in all spheres," he added.
