347.title: US President Joe Biden to celebrate Diwali at White House, calls it 'important event'
347.article_body: US President Joe Biden has plans to celebrate Diwali at the White House this year, his spokesperson Karen Jean-Pierre said. "We don't have a date to share with you at this time but it's an event that he thinks is very important as he sees a partnership with India as well as Indian Americans here in this country," Karen added.

348.title: No matter how much Rohit denies it, our death bowling is a big issue: Karim
348.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim has said no matter how much Rohit Sharma tries to deny but India's death bowling is a "big issue". He added, "It's posing a lot of headaches to the management and to Rohit...So, they need to work this out as soon as possible." Earlier, Rohit had admitted they haven't bowled well at the death in recent matches.

349.title: Eijaz Khan and Pavitra Punia get engaged, actor shares pics
349.article_body: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Eijaz Khan has got engaged to TV actress Pavitra Punia. Khan posted a series of photos on Instagram showing Pavitra Punia's response to his proposal. He wrote, "Baby, if we keep waiting for the right time, It's never gonna be, I promise you my best, Will you marry me? She said 'yes'."

350.title: Maharashtra's ration card holders to get grocery package at ₹100 for Diwali
350.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet announced Diwali package for ration card holders under which it will provide groceries at ₹100. The package will contain one kilogram of each rawa, chana dal, oil, sugar and a litre of palm oil. This package will be distributed via e-pass system and fund of ₹486.94 crore has been sanctioned for this, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said.

351.title: OnePlus Nord Watch goes on sale on Amazon's Great Indian Festival
351.article_body: The recently launched OnePlus Nord Watch is now available on Amazon Great Indian Festival sale, priced at ₹4,999, with selected bank offers. The smartwatch sports 1.78-inch AMOLED display, 60Hz refresh rate, 105 sports modes and features monitoring multiple health indicators. Available in Deep Blue and Midnight Black, it claims 10-day battery life with up to 30 days of standby time.

352.title: Coldplay postpones Brazil shows owing to Chris Martin’s lung infection
352.article_body: Coldplay announced on Twitter that they are postponing their upcoming shows in Brazil due to Chris Martin's "serious lung infection". A note shared on the social media platform read that Chris has been put "under strict doctor's orders to rest for the next three weeks". The band informed that the shows will now happen in early 2023.

353.title: 25-yr-old beaten to death over suspicion of tyre theft in Delhi, 2 held
353.article_body: A 25-year-old man was beaten to death by three others in Delhi's Alipur area over suspicion of tyre theft, following which two of the accused were arrested, police said. The victim's body was dumped near a farmhouse, police added. "There were tattoos on the man's neck and hands...had multiple injuries on his chest, head, back and legs," police further said.

354.title: Liverpool, Bayern register wins, Inter beat Barca in Champions League
354.article_body: Liverpool and Bayern Munich registered wins in their respective group matches, but Barcelona faltered 0-1 against Inter Milan on Tuesday night in the Champions League. It's Barcelona's second straight loss in the tournament after a 0-2 defeat against Bayern in their last Group C game. Meanwhile, Napoli recorded their third straight win after a 6-1 victory against 10-man Ajax.

355.title: H&M launches its festive collection with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign
355.article_body: H&M India announced the launch of its festive collection, comprising of western wear and home décor, with 'Brighter Than Ever' campaign. The collection radiates a vibrant colour palette featuring a range of blazers, dresses, tops, skirts, pants and accessories designed for celebration, H&M stated. It will be available in-stores, on H&M website and app, and on Myntra from October 5.

356.title: Pune Police busts robbery gang, arrests 6 persons
356.article_body: The Pune Police on Tuesday said they busted a robbery gang and arrested six persons. The police also claimed to have recovered 584 kg brass and copper worth ₹2.47 lakh from Lonikand. It was revealed during interrogation that the accused stole electric pumps and transformers, and sold copper and brass for profit, according to police.

357.title: Ex-German Chancellor Merkel wins UNHCR award for resettling refugees
357.article_body: Former German Chancellor Angela Merkel has won the United Nations Refugee Agency's (UNHCR) Nansen Refugee Award for welcoming more than a million refugees, mostly from Syria, into Germany. "It [the award] recognises her moral and political courage in helping more than a million refugees rebuild their lives," Filippo Grandi, UNHCR chief said. Merkel will also get $150,000 prize money.

358.title: US consulate in Hyd to auction vehicles, iPhones, furnitures, other items
358.article_body: US consulate in Hyderabad is going to conduct an online auction for four-wheelers, two-wheelers, IT equipment and several other items. The auction will take place on Accurate Auctioneers portal and it will begin at 10 am on October 12. The inspection of vehicles that will be auctioned can be done on October 11 from 9 am to 3 pm.

359.title: MSRTC suspends woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels on duty
359.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) suspended a woman bus conductor for making Instagram Reels and Facebook videos wearing her uniform during duty hours. It said it was against service rules and amounted to misconduct. The conductor, Mangal Giri, has over one lakh followers on both Instagram and Facebook. Her colleague who shot the videos is also facing action.

360.title: Celebrities call out Kanye West for 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week
360.article_body: After Kanye West wore a 'White Lives Matter' shirt at Paris Fashion Week, Jaden tweeted, "Black Lives Matter." Rapper Boosie tweeted, "Damn @kanyewest you just going to keep using your platform to s**t on your own race like this?...Do us a favour and bleach your skin all white." Supermodel Linda Evangelista wrote, "Black. Lives. Matter. Today, fashion made me sad."

361.title: Man, his 3 aides arrested for daylight murder of 35-yr-old woman in K'taka
361.article_body: Karnataka Police arrested a man and his three aides for allegedly murdering a 35-year-old Muslim woman in Gadag in daylight on the road. Initially, it was reported the murder was a hate crime as she had converted to Islam. Police later clarified that the man, along with his friends, had decided to kill the woman to avenge his brother's murder.

362.title: Tesla to remove more sensors from cars amid autopilot scrutiny
362.article_body: As Tesla faces autopilot scrutiny, it will only use cameras in its safety and driver-assistant features and will remove ultrasonic sensors from vehicles starting this month. As of now, Tesla vehicles have 12 ultrasonic sensors on the front and rear bumpers along with short-range sound sensors that are mainly used to detect close objects and while parking.

363.title: Can you buy Twitter & then delete it: Musk's ex-wife Talulah to him in a text
363.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's text messages with his ex-wife and actress Talulah Riley regarding Twitter have also become public. In one of the messages dated March 23, Talulah wrote to Musk, "Can you buy Twitter and then delete it, please!?" In another, she wrote, "Please do something to fight woke-ism...I will do anything to help! xx."

364.title: 78-yr-old man marries 18-yr-old girl in Philippines; pics go viral
364.article_body: A 78-year-old man in the Philippines has married an 18-year-old girl, with pictures from the ceremony going viral on social media. Rashed Mangacop met Halima Abdullah three years ago at a dinner party in the Cagayan province. "It was not an arranged marriage and the couple came together purely out of love," Rashed's nephew, Ben Mangacop, said.

365.title: Wonderful piece of art: Nagarjuna on Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan'
365.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna congratulated Mani Ratnam for 'Ponniyin Selvan' and called the film a "wonderful piece of art". "'Ponniyin Selvan' had always been his dream. He had talked about it to me quite a few times," Nagarjuna said. The actor added that he's seen Mani Ratnam's journey as a filmmaker and recalled his "fond memories" of working with him in 'Gitanjali'.

366.title: Tracxn Technologies fixes price band at ₹75-₹80 for October 10 IPO
366.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for its initial public offering. Tracxn's IPO will be open for subscription from October 10-12 and comprise an offer for sale of 3,86,72,208 equity shares by promoters and shareholders. Tracxn Co-founders Abhishek Goyal and Neha Singh will offload up to 76,62,655 equity shares each.

367.title: 2 friends drown in Hyderabad's Nanajipur waterfalls, bodies recovered
367.article_body: Two friends who went for a picnic at Nanajipur waterfalls located near Hyderabad’s Shamshabad drowned on Monday. The incident took place when 30-year-old Kammari Mahendhar Chary and his 19-year-old friend Md Nadeem entered the water to swim, Shamshabad police said. Later, with the help of expert swimmers, police retrieved their bodies.

368.title: Ugandan Prez fires son from military role after Kenya invasion tweet
368.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni fired his son, Muhoozi Kainerugaba, as commander of the country's infantry forces after his son tweeted that it wouldn't take him and his army two weeks to capture Kenya's capital Nairobi. However, Uganda's military said that Kainerugaba has been promoted from Lieutenant General to full general and would remain a senior presidential adviser for special operations.

369.title: Felt like setting my younger self free: Lil Nas X on wearing skirt at a show
369.article_body: Singer Lil Nas X said he felt like he was setting his "younger self free" when he walked on the stage of one of his shows wearing a skirt. "Afterwards, my family...told me they were really proud. I feel like I'm changing some minds," he added. The singer said style is "a way to show people who you are".

370.title: Delhi man, held last year, arrested again with 300 kg banned firecrackers
370.article_body: Police arrested a 43-year-old man in possession of 300 kilograms of illegal firecrackers in Delhi's Shyam Vihar area. "It was also revealed...the same person was arrested last year in the same season while selling the banned firecrackers," police said. "The accused disclosed...he had procured firecrackers from Gurugram and was selling at higher rates to earn huge profit," police added.

371.title: Police raid illegal parking lot in Gurugram Sector 48, 2 booked
371.article_body: The Gurugram Police and Chief Minister's flying squad booked two people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot during a joint raid in Sector 48. The parking lot was being run by encroaching on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) land. The CM's flying squad has identified at least 20 places in Gurugram where groups are running illegal paid parking lots.

372.title: India reports 2,468 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 33,318
372.article_body: India reported 2,468 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country stand at 33,318. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,733. This comes a day after India reported 1,968 cases, the lowest daily rise in the number of fresh COVID-19 cases since May.

373.title: I think the way Karthik batted, my no. 4 is in trouble: Suryakumar
373.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik for his 46-run innings, which included four boundaries and as many sixes, in the third T20I against South Africa, Suryakumar Yadav said, "The way he batted, my number four is in trouble." Chasing South Africa's 228-run target, India lost Rohit and Shreyas early in the game and Karthik was promoted to bat at number four.

374.title: 4 terrorists killed in 2 encounters in J&K's Shopian: Police
374.article_body: Four local terrorists were killed in two separate encounters in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, Kashmir Zone Police tweeted on Wednesday. In the first encounter that broke out in the Drach area, three terrorists linked with Jaish-e-Mohammed were killed, said police. In the second encounter that took place in the Moolu area, one terrorist linked with Lashkar-e-Taiba was killed, added police.

375.title: There's no official candidate, says Tharoor ahead of Cong Presidential polls
375.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential polls, party leader Shashi Tharoor said it's quite unfair to create an impression that there is an "official candidate". "The party President and former President have assured me that there isn't and they are neutral," Tharoor added. "I don't know why some people are trying to create such an impression. It's not fair," he stated.

376.title: Ex-US marine jailed for 4.5 years in Russia for drunken attack
376.article_body: A former US Marine has been reportedly sentenced to four-and-half years in a Russian penal colony for attacking a police officer while drunk. Police removed Robert Gilman from a train following complaints from fellow passengers in January. He was then arrested for kicking an officer while in custody. Gilman said he has "apologised to Russia" and the police officer.

377.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performs 'Shastra Puja' on Dussehra, video surfaces
377.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh performed 'Shastra Puja' at Auli Military Station in Chamoli, Uttarakhand on the occasion of Dussehra. "We're confident that our country is safe in the hands of our armed forces. India is the only country where 'puja' of weapons is performed," he said. Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was also present during the ceremony.

378.title: Rohit bursts into laughter after calling Suryakumar's form a 'big concern', video viral
378.article_body: During the presentation ceremony following the third T20I against South Africa, India captain Rohit Sharma jokingly stated that the form of Suryakumar Yadav, who got out for 8(6), is a "big concern". Rohit then burst into laughter after making the sarcastic statement. "I thought that was least of your concerns," Murali Kartik commented. Suryakumar was named Player of the Series.

379.title: I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage: Melinda on divorce with Bill
379.article_body: Melinda French Gates in an interview spoke about her "unbelievably painful" divorce with ex-husband Bill. She said, "I had some reasons I just couldn't stay in that marriage anymore…But the odd thing about COVID is that it gave me the privacy to do what I needed to do." They announced their divorce in May 2021, after 27 years of marriage.

380.title: Pune woman cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in online gift fraud case
380.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹3.23 lakh in an online gift fraud case by a fraudster claiming to be a doctor in a foreign country, police said. The accused told her he had sent a gift but it had been seized by customs officials, police added. The woman transferred ₹3.23 lakh but never received the gift, police stated.

381.title: Traffic streamlined on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, 3 exits shut near Chipyana ROB
381.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has closed three exits near the newly constructed Chipyana rail overbridge to streamline the flow of traffic on Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME). The three exits, present within a distance of about two kilometres, were opened to ease traffic flow when the rail overbridge, which was the last pending structure on DME, was under construction.

382.title: Struggled with bat in 1st T20I, bowling in 2nd, but were clinical in 3rd: Bavuma
382.article_body: After their 49-run win in the third and final T20I against India, South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, "A win like this is always good for confidence." He added, "We struggled with the bat in the first game, our bowling wasn't best in the last game, but we were clinical today." South Africa's Rilee Rossouw slammed 100*(48) in the game.

383.title: Nitish Kumar came to me begging after losing 2014 LS polls: Prashant Kishor
383.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar went to him "begging" after losing the 2014 Lok Sabha elections. "I assisted him in winning the 2015 Assembly polls as the chief ministerial candidate of the 'Mahagathbandhan'. Today, he has the temerity to offer 'gyan' (wisdom) to me," Kishor added.

384.title: 5 die as 4 cars, ambulance collide on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; video surfaces
384.article_body: At least five persons died following a collision between four cars and an ambulance on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link on Wednesday morning, Mumbai Police said. Earlier, it was reported that 10 persons got injured in the collision. Notably, the ambulance and other vehicles were preparing to take the victims of an earlier accident to a hospital.

385.title: LED TV explosion kills 16-year-old, creates massive hole in house wall in UP
385.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after an LED TV exploded at his house in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The explosion, which injured the teen's mother, sister-in-law and a friend, left a massive hole in a wall of the house. "The explosion was so powerful, the entire house shook and parts of the wall collapsed," a family member said.

386.title: PM Modi greets people on Vijayadashami, wishes them positive energy
386.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted people on the occasion of Vijayadashami on Wednesday. "Many congratulations to all citizens on Vijayadashami, the symbol of victory. I wish that this auspicious occasion brings courage, restraint and positive energy in everyone's life," he tweeted. The PM is expected to participate in Kullu Dussehra celebrations in Himachal Pradesh today.

387.title: Crying at 9 am, video conferencing at 10 am: Melinda on working with Bill amid divorce
387.article_body: In an interview, Melinda French Gates spoke about working with Bill Gates amid their divorce. She said, "Even though I might be crying at 9 am and then have to be on a videoconference at 10 am with the person I'm leaving, I [had] to show up and be my best...I learned as a leader that I could do it."

388.title: Finally working with Karan Johar: Sara on 'Ae Watan Mere Watan'
388.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is feeling blessed about collaborating with Karan Johar for her upcoming film 'Ae Watan Mere Watan', which was announced on October 4. "After all the magnanimity, friendship, advice, generosity and love - finally working with you, Karan Johar," she wrote.  Karan said he's excited to welcome Sara on board "to tell a powerful true story".

389.title: Imran Khan biggest liar on earth, he ruined country's economy: Pak PM
389.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has accused his predecessor Imran Khan of being "the biggest liar on the face of the earth". Sharif also alleged that Khan's policies had left the country's economy in "ruins". Talking to The Guardian, Sharif also accused Khan of "injecting poison" into society to "dangerously polarise the electorate" after he was ousted from power in April.

390.title: Youth kidnaps 11-year-old girl from Mumbai pandal, rapes her
390.article_body: A 19-year-old youth allegedly kidnapped an 11-year-old girl from a garba pandal in Mumbai and raped her. The victim had gone to the pandal with her sister, who made a quick trip home and when she returned, her sister was missing. The parents approached the police, who tracked down and arrested the suspect. He confessed he sexually assaulted the victim.

391.title: Delhi Police shares similarities between 'Dandiya' and 'Driving' in road safety tweet
391.article_body: A day before Dussehra, the Delhi Traffic Police shared a series of tweets to spread awareness about road safety rules. The traffic police posted an image stating similarities between 'Dandiya' with 'Driving' and shared it saying, "Ae Haalo Re Haalo! Road par GARBAd nahi karo, araam se chalo! (Don’t panic on the road, relax and drive)."

392.title: Bumrah's absence big loss, but also opportunity for someone else: Dravid
392.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has admitted Jasprit Bumrah's absence will be a "big loss" for the side in the T20 WC in Australia. Dravid, however, also added it's an opportunity for someone else to step up. On India's defeat in the third SA T20I, Dravid said, "[Had] Karthik and Pant continued for four-five overs more, it could've been closer."

393.title: Sriti Jha, Kili Paul to enter 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' as wild cards
393.article_body: After Dutee Chand's voluntary exit from 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', the dance reality show will welcome Sriti Jha, Kili Paul, Nishant Bhat, and singer Ada Malik as wild card contestants. However, the Tanzanian social media creator will appear on the show for only a few episodes. Sriti and Nishant were last seen in Rohit Shetty's 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'.

394.title: 'Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Putin', Zelenskyy tells PM Modi on phone
394.article_body: During a phone call with PM Narendra Modi, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Ukraine will not conduct negotiations with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Zelenskyy said that all the aggressor's decisions aimed at attempting illegal annexation of Ukrainian territories do not change reality. He also emphasised the importance of PM Modi's recent statement that now is not the time for war.

395.title: Parts of Pune to face water cuts on Thursday due to repair work
395.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that water supply will be cut off in various parts of the city on Thursday due to repair work. The maintenance work will be carried out at Warje water works, Chandani Chowk water tank, Gandhi Bhavan, SNDT, Swargate etc. Water supply will be restored on Friday with low pressure, added the PMC.

396.title: Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app: Musk
396.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has proposed to proceed with his original offer of $44 billion to acquire Twitter. Soon after, Musk tweeted, "Buying Twitter is an accelerant to creating X, the everything app." While he didn't explain what 'X app' could entail, he added, "Twitter probably accelerates X by 3 to 5 years, but I could be wrong."

397.title: Mumbai local trains decorated amid Dussehra, pics surface
397.article_body: String decorations have been put up inside Mumbai local trains amid Dussehra celebrations and commuters shared pictures of the decorated train on social media. Last week, a video of a group of women performing Garba dance aboard a Mumbai local train also went viral on social media. The group of women performed Garba when the train reached Kalyan station.

398.title: Delhi withdraws ₹500 fine for not wearing masks in public
398.article_body: Delhi Disaster Management Authority has withdrawn the order imposing a fine of ₹500 for not wearing masks in public places from October 1. The services of health care workers hired on a contract basis in COVID-19 hospitals have been extended till the end of 2022, it added. Delhi on Tuesday reported 74 COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 1.07%.

399.title: Brad Pitt poured beer on our kids, choked one of them on private jet: Jolie
399.article_body: In a lawsuit filed on Tuesday, Angelina Jolie has alleged that Brad Pitt choked one of their children and hit another while on a private jet in 2016. Jolie also claimed that Pitt poured beer and red wine on the children. Jolie's lawyers filed the suit in the couple's legal battle over their French winery.

400.title: Twitter confirms receiving Musk's buyout offer, says will close at original price
400.article_body: Twitter confirmed that it has received Tesla CEO Elon Musk's letter for the buyout deal and said it "intends to close the transaction at $54.20 per share", the same price he agreed to in April. Musk's lawyers added that they'll proceed with the agreement if Delaware Chancery Court will "adjourn the trial and other proceedings related to the ongoing lawsuit".

401.title: 25 killed after bus carrying over 40 persons falls into gorge in Uttarakhand
401.article_body: At least 25 persons were killed after a bus carrying a wedding party of over 40 persons fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal on Tuesday night. "Police and SDRF rescued 21 people overnight; the injured have been admitted to nearby hospitals," Uttarakhand DGP Ashok Kumar said. The wedding procession left in bus from Laldhang, Haridwar SP City said.

402.title: US, South Korea fire 4 missiles after North Korea fires missile over Japan
402.article_body: US and South Korea fired four ground-to-ground missiles into the Sea of Japan in response to North Korea firing a ballistic missile over Japan for the first time in five years on Tuesday. The Army Tactical Missile System (ATACMS) missiles hit mock targets, the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said. South Korea had called North Korea's launch a "provocation".
